loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils (jugs, cups, plates) for resale.

loans.name: Duhuzanye Sk Group

texts.fr: Sylveste H. est commerçant, et il est un membre du groupe Duhuzanye.  Il a 41 ans, il est marié, et il a fini 8 ans d’école primaire.  Il a 3 enfants, entre 9 ans et 12 ans, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour sa commerce de boutique, et sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de collabore beaucoup avec ses clients pour les attires.  Il voudrait augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, et scolarise ses enfants.
texts.en: Sylveste H. is a merchant and a member of the Duhuzanye group. He is 41 years old, married, and has finished eight years of primary schooling.  He has three children between nine and twelve years of age, all of whom attend school.  He is going to use his loan for his retail business, and his strategy for growing his business is to collaborate with his clients in order to attract them.  He would like to increase his turnover and to educate his children.

loans.use: retail business

loans.name: Sena Veronique

texts.fr: Véronique est mariée et a 4 enfants en charge. Elle a déjà remboursé plusieurs crédits a travers cette activité. En effet, elle fait la vente de tissus et compte  2 ans d’expérience.   Elle achète ses tissus au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite au marché local d’adakpamé.  Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter de nouveaux lots de tissus.
texts.en:
Véronique is married and has four children to support. 

Through her business activity, she has already repaid several loans. She has two years' experience selling fabrics.  She buys her fabrics at the big market in Lomé and then resells them at the local Adakpamé market. 

Véronique is requesting a loan to buy new bolts of fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Khatmeh

texts.en:
Khatmeh is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past one year, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby.  Khatmeh faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and potatoes.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To trade goats

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school, while the other one is still too young for school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop for the past three years, selling to her neighbouring community.  In addition she does farming which contributes to her other source of income.  Christine faces a major challenge of theft and high competition from other retail operators in her business.  She hopes to expand and establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With 20,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey sells spare parts for Russian and Ukrainian cars. Since these parts are in high demand, his business is quite successful.  Andrey has been an entrepreneur for 10 years. He has good business qualities such as honesty and respect toward his customers. He always knows what his clients need. His pricing also attracts customers.

Andrey enjoys his business and wants to develop it further. He is requesting a loan of 18,000 Grivnas to purchase more inventory. This will allow him to increase the variety of his offerings and to better serve his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Mujeres  Activas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Blanca Rosa O. de Candia, que vive en la cuidad de Villarrica. Ella realizó la invitación y todas encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Urbanas nombrando al Comité Mujeres Activas.
        Las integrantes del comité se dedican a la Artesanía, que es un trabajo que heredaron de sus padres y va pasando de generación en generación.
     Confeccionando hermosas prendas de vestir como ser: camisas, manteles, en aopo´i, también las integrantes se dedican al comercio de productos alimenticios, también productos hortícolas, como así también a la peluquería.
A la misma actividad también se dedica la señora Blanca quein es la presidenta del grupo y trabajado artesana. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas para aopo´i y colorantes para las telas. 

     Las integrantes de este comité agradecen a Kiva y a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo ofrecido y manifiestan que gracias a ello van a poder seguir trabajando y dándole a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Mrs. Blanca Rosa O. de Candia, who lives in the city of Villarrica. She extended the invitation and they all were happy to accept. They formed the urban women's committee called Comité Mujeres Activas [Active Women's Committee]. 

The members of the committee work in artisanal crafts. This is work that they inherited from their parents; it is passed down from generation to generation.         

They make beautiful articles such as: shirts, tablecloths and aopo'i. The members also work in selling food products, as well as produce, as well as cutting hair.    

Blanca works in this same activity. She is the president of the group and an artisan. She is asking for the loan to buy the fabric for aopo'i and fabric dyes.  

The members of this committee are grateful to Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have offered and they say that thanks to it they are going to be able to continue working and giving their families a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fabric and fabric dyes.

loans.name: Nicha

texts.fr:
Âgée de 24ans, mariée, mère  d’un enfant en bas âge, avec son niveau terminal, n’ayant pas reçu à son baccalauréat, elle se lance dans la vente des produits  cosmétiques et boissons importées. 

En 2007,elle  ouvre une boutique et s'approvisionne à Kinshasa et sur place dans les magasins de ventes des produits cosmétiques en gros.
Le prêt passé lui a permis de renouveler son stock en achetant plus les laits de beauté, les savons, les crèmes, les tubes éclaircis santes, les produits defrisants, et démêlants  et la boisson importée.

Avant le premier prêt, elle vendait en moyenne 15.000f par jour, maintenant , avec les enseignements reçus, elle a épargner et rembourser son prêt sans difficultés.
Le prochain prêt, sera là pour contribuer à ses projets, à savoir moderniser sa parfumerie en ajoutant les produits de marques, renforcer son stock.
Très motivée pour ce type de commerce, elle pense  sortir du pays, aller acheter a l'étranger pour être fournisseur des produits cosmétiques et a la longue ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en:
Nicha is 24 years old, the mother of a young child, and she did not complete her schooling. She has a business selling cosmetics and imported drinks. 

In 2007 she opened a boutique store. She makes her purchases in Kinshasa and in stores that sell cosmetics in wholesale.  The previous loan helped her to resupply her business with the purchase of beauty lotions, soaps, skin creams, hair treatment products, and conditioners, as well as imported drinks. 

Prior to her initial loan, her sales averaged 15.000f per day. But today with the training she has received, she has been able to save some money and pay back the loan without any problem. 

This next loan will be used towards her business. She will update her perfume store to include brand name products, and she will resupply her store. She is very motivated in her business. She is thinking about going out of the country to make her pruchases and become a supplier of comestics. She wants to have open a large store one day.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, wigs, and impored drinks.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr:
Cliente de 49 ans, célibataire et mère de 6 enfants , elle se lance dans la vente des produits pharmaceutiques pour prendre soin de sa famille , elle ouvre un étalage des produits pharmaceutiques dans le marche qui est non loin de son habitation,.Elle avait bénéficié d’un premier prêt  qu’elle a gérer avec succès.

Elle avait renforcé son activité en achetant beaucoup des produits en gros  tels que : les antitussifs, antibiotiques, des solutions salées /sucrées et autres dont les demandes sont fortes.

Le deuxième prêt, contribuera aussi à remonter son commerce qui selon elle s’est stabilisé avec son nouveau système de gestion. Elle a maitrisée le journal de caisse et la gestion de stock, elle compte épargner plus pour pouvoir bénéficier  des prêts plus important afin de réaliser ses objectifs : Ouvrir une pharmacie de ventes des produits en gros.
 
Elle fait suffisamment des bénéfices maintenant qu'elle aide a payer les frais d'écolage de ses enfants et épargne pour atteindre ses projets d'avenir, aider son mari a construire une maison pour toute la famille.
texts.en:
A 49-year old client, single and the mother of six, she launched a business selling pharmaceutical products in order to support her family. She opened a stall with pharmaceutical products at a market near her home. She already had a prior loan and managed it successfully. 

She bolstered her business purchasing many products wholesale, such as cough medicine, antibiotics, saline and sugar solutions and other products in high demand.

The second loan will also contribute to the growth of her business. According to her, the new management system. She has learned how to keep a ledger and better manage her stock. She plans to save more in order to be able to obtain bigger loans and achiever her goal of opening  a wholesale pharmacy. She makes enough now to be able to pay for her children’s schooling. She is also putting many away for future projects, to help her husband build a house for the entire family.

loans.use: Purchasing pharmaceutical products: rubber alcohol,  Betadine, Betazol, Paracetamol, Chloramphenicol etc

loans.name: Mango Tree Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Six years is the time 46-year old Joseph K. has been teaching in schools in and around Mukono, principally in Nkonkonjeru. He is also a deputy headteacher at one of the schools. Teaching, like other professions, requires diligence, integrity and steadfastness. In that regard, Joseph has not fallen short. 

Joseph is happily married with four children, three of whom attend school. Before he seriously took up teaching, he used to sell agricultural produce. He still sells agricultural produce, though teaching is now his main pursuit. 

Joseph is affiliated  with Mango tree development group-Mukono. He says he makes monthly profits in the sum of 80,000 Ugandan shillings. With this loan, Joseph says he is going to purchase more books for the school library in one of the schools he teaches in.

loans.use: To purchase more books for the school library.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
Mireya forma parte del banco comunal “Nehuen Wentru Lamuen”, de la ciudad de Osorno. Ella tiene un carrito en donde vende maní salado, confitado y tostado, manzanas confitadas y otros dulces, desde hace 6 años en el centro de la ciudad. Vende de lunes a sábado de 9 h hasta las 21 h. Ella atiende en las mañanas y en las tardes atiende su esposo. 
Con este préstamo comprará un poco de mercadería y principalmente papel, cintas  y tarjetitas para hacer bolsas de regalo para venderlas hechas y también para envolver regalos junto a su carrito, aprovechando la época navideña. Su sueño es tener un local establecido y vender frutos secos. 
Vive con su esposo  y con su pequeña hija de 9 años. 
A Mireya le ha sido muy grato trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, ya que siente que han confiado en ella al entregarle los préstamos. También siente un agradable ambiente familiar en las reuniones junto a sus compañeros y asesor. Además le han servido mucho las enseñanzas sobre administración de su negocio, que les han entregado durante las reuniones. 
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios. Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
Mireya is a member of the "Nehuen Wentru Lamuen" communal bank in Osorno. For the last 6 years, she has been selling salted, crystallised and toasted peanuts, crystallised apples and other sweets from a cart in the city centre. She opens the cart from Monday to Saturday, 9am until 9pm. She looks after it in the mornings and her husband takes over in the afternoons. 
With the loan she will buy a few goods but mostly paper, ribbons and tags for making gift bags. She will sell these ready-made, and also use them to wrap presents at her cart, taking advantage of the Christmas period. Her dream is to have a fixed premises and to sell nuts and dried fruits. She lives with her husband and 9-year old daughter.
Mireya has enjoyed working with Fondo Esperanza, as she feels that they have trusted her enough to give her loans. She also feels there is a pleasant family atmosphere at the meetings, which she attends with her co-members and advisor. She has also benefited a lot from their tuition on business administration, which they delivered during the meetings. 
Osorno is a city located in the southern Chile, in the lake district. It is an important agricultural centre known as Chile's "Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" (Home of the Milk and Land of the Meat). The area's principal farming activity is the cultivation of wheat and oats, livestock rearing for meat and milk processing, and the production of farming equipment. Osorno also boasts Chile's only covered football ground, the "Rubén Marcos" municipal stadium.

loans.use: Sweets, paper and gift ribbon.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana forma parte del banco comunal “Banco de la Fe” perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares. Ella  vende ropa de adultos y niños, y accesorios como por ejemplo cosmetiqueros y billeteras, por encargos y a domicilio. También hace y vende empanadas en una cancha cerca de su casa, solo los días domingos. Además trabaja de forma dependiente durante la semana como maestra de cocina en un restaurante. Para aumentar la venta de sus productos, vendiendo en la semana mientras trabaja, le ayuda su hija, a quien le paga una comisión por venta y, además,  a una señora para que le ayude a cocinar las empanadas.
Con este préstamo comprará ropa e ingredientes para las empanadas, es decir harina huevos, aceitunas, carne, cebolla y pasas. 
Ana tiene 5 hijos, pero solo viven con ella 3, de los cuales dos estudian, el menor de 11 años y su hijo de 22 que está en su último año de universidad estudiando construcción civil.
El sueño de Ana es tener un carrito para la venta de comida rápida. 
Está muy agradecida de la oportunidad de crecer económicamente que le ha dado Fondo Esperanza, por medio de los préstamos. También se siente muy acogida por la unidad de sus compañeros de grupo.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the community bank named « Banco de la Fe » and it is located in the city of Linares. She sells kids’ and adults’ clothing and accessories, such as make-up bags and wallets. She sells from her home and she also takes orders. She also sells prepared foods in a park nearby, but only on Sundays. She also works during the week as a cooking instructor in a restaurant. In order to increase the sale of her products her daughter helps her during the week while she is at work.  She pays her commission for the sales she makes and she also hires someone to help her make the foods to sell. 

She will purchase items of clothing and ingredients with this loan, such as: cooking flour, eggs, olives, meats, onions, and potatoes. 

She has 5 children, but only 3 of them live with her, and only two of them are in school. The youngest is 11 years old. Her son who is 22 years old is in his last year in university, where he is studying civil engineering. 

Ana’s dream is to have a car to be able to sell prepared foods quickly. She is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner) for the opportunity to grow financially through these loans. She feels very close to the members of the group for the strong sense of community. 

Linares is an large urban centre in the region of Maule. It is located in the central part of the country. This is region is an important producer, strong in agriculture and vineyards, and an exporter of their goods. The primary products are cereal grains (rice, wheat, corn, and oats), and produce (beets, cabbage, lettuce, spinach and legumes) and fruits. Linares is the primary producer of rice in Chile. In fact, 78% of cereals consumed in the country are produced in this province, especially in the community of Parral.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and ingredients.

loans.name: Katungamo Women's Voice- Group

texts.en:
A. Jennifer is the leader of Katungamo women’s Voice group in Ntungamo. She is 42 years old and married with seven children.

She is involved in the sale of produce, especially beans, millet, peas, ground nuts, and maize. Some produce she grows herself, and she also tops up her stock by buying from other farmers. She has been in business for 15 years and she needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale. 

She is a very hardworking and determined woman, in addition to being very helpful to her family. She is a very strong pillar in her home.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a married man with two children, who are both attending school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

He has been operating a retail shop for the past six years.  His local neighbours and town dwellers are his potential customers. In addition, he also operates a motorcycle business to contribute to his income. Thomas faces a major challenge in seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate the business. He hopes to purchase a public-vehicle van in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair motorcycle

loans.name: James Ogutu

texts.en:
James O. is a single 28-year old livestock farmer in the Kibos area located on the outskirts of Kisumu City, along the shores of Lake Victoria. 

James rears goats for sale to butcheries in the city of Kisumu, and also for their milk, which is loved by many in the area because of its high quality. He enjoys working on his goat farm, which he has managed for the last three years with success. He makes a monthly income of 28,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) which he uses to support his siblings. 

He is requesting a third loan of 50,000 Kshs, which he will use to buy more goats as a way to expand his business and increase his portfolio. James will use the profits to further his education so that he can gather skills to manage his business. Specifically, he hopes to attain some educational levels in agriculture because this will give him new ideas and skills to manage the goat business. 

He hopes that a Kiva lender will help him attain his dreams and desires.

loans.use: To buy more goats for rearing.

loans.name: Georgines

texts.fr:
Femme de 63 ans,veuve,mère de 3 enfants , pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille , elle ouvre un restaurant de spécialité Africaine  ou elle vend du poisson d'eau douce en bouillon et a l'étouffe dans des feuille,  depuis bientôt 20 ans.
Le prêt passé a contribuer a renforcer son stock de poisson d'eau douce comme les carpes, silures, lamproie, anguilles et   à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vente, elle  a entre autre palier  aux différentes intempéries en ajoutant des tôles, quelques ustensiles de cuisines et a fait un stock en  provisions. 

Avec le prêt actuel, elle va renforcer son stock en faisant des provisions de poisson de toutes qualités que les clients demandent souvent.Ses ventes et sa clientèle  ont augmentes, ses recettes journalières sont de 50.000 a 125.000frs par jour.
Tres entreprenante , elle tient a aller au bout de ses ambitions,et ouvrir un grand resto pour ses enfants qu'elle pourra leur laisser le jour ou elle ne sera plus la.
texts.en:
Sixty-three-old widow, mother of 3 children. To meet her family's needs, about 20 years ago she opened a restaurant specializing in African cuisine where she sells freshwater fish in stock and braised in leaves. Her previous loan was used to buy more freshwater fish such as carp, catfish, lampreys, and eel, along with the improvement of her selling conditions, she wants to buy among other things, landings to protect from bad weather, sheet metal, some cooking utensils, and provisions.

With the current loan, she will buy more fish of various kinds that her clients often ask for. Her sales and client base have increased. Her daily receipts range from 50,000 to 125,000 francs.
She is a true entrepreneur, she wants to make the most of her ambitions and open a large restaurant that she will be able to leave to her children when she passes away.

loans.use: Purchase of freshwater fish: catfish, lampreys, carp; seasonings, oil

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Delia Epifania A. C. que vive en la cuidad de Villarrica. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras nombrando al Comité Las Triunfadoras.
      La  mayoría de las integrantes se dedican a la elaboración de productos  alimenticios, como empanadas, sandwich, milanesas, y una parte se dedica a la reventa de mercaderías como remeras, camisas, pantalones, short, buzos, camisillas, lencerías.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Delia quien tiene una despensa y se dedica a la atención de la misma, se encuentra satisfecha ya que le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y así ella no necesita nada para la alimentación. 
Para esta época que llega desea estar prepara  con todas las mercaderías y para ello solicita el préstamo y comprar entre otras cosa vinos, sidras, gaseosas, golosinas, dulces, enlatados, embutidos, aceites. 
    Las Señoras agradecen a Kiva y a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo ofrecido porque gracias a eso lograron mejorar sus ingresos y  de esta manera sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group was formed with the efforts of Mrs. Delia Epifania Aramendia C.. She lives in the city of Villarrica. The members came together the group joined Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras under the name of Las Triunfadoras.

The majority of the members sell prepared foods, such as meat pies, sandwiches, meat patties. Some of the members have retail businesses from where they sell jackets, shirts, slacks, shorts, tank tops, undergarments, and lingerie.  

Delia is one of the members and she has a convenience store that she manages herself. She is very happy with the business because she is able to contribute towards the household expenses and she doesn’t need any support to buy the groceries. 

Especially for this time of year she wants to be ready with all the merchandise she will need, and to this end she requests a loan. She will purchase, among other things, wines, cidre, soft drinks, snacks, sweets, canned goods, and cooking oil. 

The women in this group convey their thanks to Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) for the support they have offered. It is thanks to this support that they have improved their incomes and consequently, their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nabikakala Womens Club Group

texts.en:
N. Agnes is the leader of Nabikakala women’s group in Mubende. She is 34 years old and married with five children.

Two years ago, she opened a boutique that sells clothes and shoes from Kyamukoona. Agnes has been blessed with customers, most of whom shop there again after realizing the quality of her goods. She is also a farmer and she sells produce from her farm. It was due to the ready market in the area that she opted for this business. 

She is able to make 70,000 Ugandan shillings in weekly profits, which is very helpful in re-investing in her business. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hortely Vigel

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 32ans, mariée, mère de 3enfants , a l'arrêt de ses études au lycée,pour aider sa famille a s'épanouir, elle se lance dans la boucherie en 2003.

Elle avait renforcé son stock en achetant des cartons de : viande, poulets, cuisses de poulets, Queue de bœuf , tripe, saucissons à l’ail, pieds de porcs.
Le remboursement du premier prêt s'est fait sans difficultés, les enseignements reçus ont beaucoup contribué à l'évolution de son activité ,ses revenus sont passés de 50.000f à 180.000f par jour.

Avec le deuxième prêt qu’elle aura pendant cette période des fêtes, elle va achetée  plus des cartons des cuisses de poulets et de viandes arrière.
La politique de gestion des crédits de notre institution à développé en elle un esprit d’épargne.
A l’avenir, elle veut ouvrir une boucherie – poissonnerie pour élargir son activité augmenter ses rendements de son activité afin de contribuer à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Young 32-year-old married woman, mother of 3. After finishing high school, she became a butcher in 2003 to help her family with their expenses.

Her stock consists of boxes of beef, chicken, chicken thighs, oxtail, tripe, garlic salami, pigs' feet. She repaid her previous loan with no problems. The information posted greatly contributed to an increase in business for her: her profits increased from 50,000 to 180,000 francs per day.

With her second loan that she'll receive during the festival season, she will buy more boxes of chicken thighs and beef hindquarters.
Our institutions policy of loan management has fostered a spirit of sharing in her.

In the future, she would like to open a butcher shop/fish shop to increase her business and profits, so she will be able to contribute to her childrens' education.

loans.use: Purchase of boxes of beef, sides of pork, tripe, oxtail

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
K. Oliver is an individual client from Kihihi. She is 33 years old and married. She has a 9-year old child and a set of 7-year old twins.

Oliver is a salary earner who is also a farmer. She sells her produce to the local community, and the profits help her to provide for her family's needs. Oliver is requesting a loan to be able to buy more land for agriculture.

loans.use: To buy land for agriculture.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase bags of maize, rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Ndeeba Tukorerehamwe Group

texts.en: T. Charity, with hand raised, is the leader of Ndeeba tukorerehamwe group in Kihihi. She is 28 years old and married with two children aged 7 and 5, and has been in the business of selling rice in Mizimera trading centre for two years. She started the business with capital from agriculture and because she is hard-working and cooperative, she has been able to specialize and she is benefitting from that. She is able to make KSH50,000 in weekly profits and she hopes it will continue increasing. She needs a loan to stock more sacks of rice for resale.

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Erich

texts.es:
El señor Erich  de 21 años de edad, soltero, joven emprendedor, realiza instalaciones de polarizados para todo tipo de vehículo, también de alarmas y radio además vende todo tipo de artículos para equipamiento de vehículo como, tazas de vehículos, kit de tunig, amplificador, seguro capot y varios mas. Empezó hace tres años trabajando en una playa de vehículos, el se encargaba de realizar los polarizados, actualmente cuenta con un local que alquila, donde realiza los servicios y venta de artículos para tunig, gracias al apoyo de sus padres y de préstamos realizados le va muy bien, cuenta con mucha clientela.
Solicita nuevamente apoyo crediticio para la compra de mas accesorios para tunig de vehículo ya que aumento bastante la demanda.
Erich agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad, porque gracias a eso él podrá seguir brindado a sus clientes el mejor servicio, y vender los mejores accesorios para tunig.
texts.en:
Erich is 21, single, a young entrepreneur, who installs tinted windows for all types of cars, and alarms, and radios.  He also sells many kinds of products to equip cars such as hubcaps, tuning kits, speakers, security systems, etc.  He began 3 years ago working in a car lot where he was in charge of the tinting.   He now has a shop that he rents where he does his work and sells tuning equipment.  Thanks for the support of his parents and loans that he has received, he is doing well with his customers.
He is requesting a loan to buy more articles for car tune ups since the demand has increased.
Erich appreciates the Fundación Paraguaya  and Kiva for the opportunity because thanks to them , he has been able to offer his customers better service and sell the best accessories for tune ups.

loans.use: Installing tinted windows, alarms, raidios and sale of products for car tune ups.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: B. Ruth is an individual client from Mubende. She is 44 years old and married with six children. She has had a boutique that sells clothes from Kyenda for 10 years and is able to make enough sales in a week to live on. Now she needs a loan to buy more clothes to stock for the Christmas festive season. Ruth was inspired to start her business by the demand in the area and she does not regret it.

loans.use: Buy clothes to stock for the Christmas festive season.

loans.name: Juliah Muthoni

texts.en:
Juliah is a married woman of 31 with two children aged three and seven. She sells spare parts in Grogan next to a garage in the town centre. She also sells snacks and soft drinks to the workers around her shop. She has been doing this for the last three years.
 
She got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. She plans to buy snacks for Kshs 10,000, soft drinks for Kshs 12,000, brake fluid for Kshs 20,000, and nuts and bolts for Kshs 10,000.

In future she hopes to open a bigger auto parts store and garage.

loans.use: Buy snacks, soft drinks, brake fluid, and nuts and bolts

loans.name: Munafa Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Munafa” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata is thirty-five years old.  She was born in Kabala town where she currently resides with her husband and five children. Her husband is a farmer and three of her children are attending primary school. 

Fatmata has been selling market food for the past three years.  With her share of this loan, she will buy garden eggs, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, tomatoes, salts, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy food to resell

loans.name: Valens

texts.fr: Valens S. est réparateur des téléphones, chauffeur de taxi, et choriste dans son église.  Il a 31 ans, il est marie, et il a 5 enfants entre 2 ans et 13 ans.  Il a fini 5 ans d’école primaire, et 4 de ses enfants vont a l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pièces de rechange pour revendre, un ordinateur et autres matériels de réparation des téléphones.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’offrir des services de qualités, avoir la ponctualité, la régularité et augmenter des heures de travail, et aussi élever sa connaissance de la réparation des téléphones.  Il voudrait avoir un grand atelier de réparation téléphone, et autre matériel électronique ou on trouve des matériels complet.  Il voudrait aussi avoir un studio de musique.  Pour la famille, il voudrait donner une bonne éducation a ses enfants, et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Valens S. is a telephone repairman, taxi driver, and sings in his church's choir. He is 31 years old, married, and has five children between 2 and 13 years of age. He has finished 5 years of grade school, and 4 of his children are in school. He is going to use his loan to buy spare parts to sell, a computer, and other telephone repair materials. His plan to increase business is to offer quality services, be on time, be consistent with his work, and increase his work hours, in addition to learning more about telephone repair. He would like to own a large telephone repair shop and other electronic materials to make his collection more complete. He would also like to have a music studio. As for his family, he wants to make sure his children receive a good education, and he wants to ensure their well-being.

loans.use: Purchase of used spare parts for telephones to sell, a computer, and other materials to repair telephones

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is 37 years old, married to Peter Okeyo. They have three children; Felistus 14 years old, Brian 11 years old and Eunice eight years old. 

Rose is in the business of selling second-hand clothes and has been doing it for 10 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who has benefited from the loans. Rose intends to use the money to buy more bales of clothes to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to cater to the family’s needs and also pay school fees for her children

Her dream is to start selling new clothes.

loans.use: Buy bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a Lis Jorgelina N. G., que vive en la cuidad de Potrero Melgarejo Loma. Encantados aceptaron conformar el Comité de mujeres rurales nombrando al Comité Mujeres Alegres.
 La señora Jorgelina es la presidenta del grupo, ella es una mejer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. 
Esta actividad es muy común entre las mujeres de la zona y producen en gran cantidad y con mucha calidad sus prendas y las mismas son muy admirados por los clientes. 
En ocasiones cuando reciben muchos pedidos trabajan todas juntas para cumplir con los pedidos.
En esta ocasiones ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas y colorantes para la telas. 

   Las integrantes del comité se dedican al  comercio, cría de cerdos, artesanía  etc. 

  Con la ayuda que le ofreció la Fundación Paraguaya, este comité logro mejorar sus ingresos y  también mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This communal bank was founded by Lis Jorgelina Nunez G., who lives in the town of Potrero Melgarejo Loma. The members of the communal bank are female farmers, who named it "Comité Mujeres Alegres" ("Cheerful Women Committee"). 

Jorgelina is the group's president. She is very hard-working and makes handicrafts. This is a very common activity amongst women in the area, who produce a great quantity of high quality garments that are very much admired by customers. Sometimes, when they receive large orders, they join up to work together in order to fulfil them. 

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and fabric dyes.Communal bank members work in commerce, pig farming, handicrafts and other. With the help offered by Fundacion Paraguaya the communal bank members have managed to improve their income and their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and fabric dyes.

loans.name: Rwenshama Tukore Group A

texts.en:
N. Benon is the leader of 'Rwenshama Tukore' group in Rukungiri. He is 49 years old and married with 5 children, and he has a retail shop in Rwenshama that has been in existence for over 10 years. On average, he is able to make 360,000/= as weekly profits and his hard work has enabled him to succeed. 

He needs a loan to be able to buy more sugar, drinks and foodstuffs for the shop so that he will be able to make more income. His dream is to improve his family's welfare and also expand his business.

loans.use: Buying more sugar, drinks and foodstuffs for his shop

loans.name: Marie-Claire

texts.fr: Marie-Claire K. a 53 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 6 enfants entre 18 ans et 30 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour la réparation de l’immeuble d’habitation.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’éviter de locataires douteux sans ressources financières.  Elle voudrait améliorer le secteur agricole, construire d’autres maisons a louer, et ouvrir une activité commerciale.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait permettre a ses enfants de bien poursuivre les études jusqu'à université.  Marie-Claire est aussi agricultrice, et elle voudrait devenir un membre d’un coopératif.
texts.en: Marie-Claire K. is 53 years old, a widow, with six children between 18 and 30 years of age. Four of her children study. She is going to use her loan for repairing her house. Her strategy for growing revenues is to avoid unreliable tenants who lack financial resources. She would like to improve her agricultural business, to have other rental houses built, and to open a store. For her family, she would like to allow her children to continue their studies through university level. Marie-Claire is also a farmer, and she would like to join an agricultural co-operative.

loans.use: Housing repairs

loans.name: Kasenge Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en:
N. Justine, 46, has been a businesswoman for the last 10 years in Mbalala-Mukono. Over the course of these years, she has been managing her grocery store business. This has, to a certain degree, been a satisfactory means of subsistence for her and her family. The happily married mother of 6 says self-interest and efficiency are what spawned her business. 

Before she embarked on this business journey, she was mostly involved in a modest old clothes sales business. The business is still in existence though it is second fiddle as of now. The grocery store business has been doing well, judging by the 600,000 shilling profits she makes monthly. With this loan, Justine says she is going to revamp her grocery business and also buy more bales of old clothes for resale. 

Justine belongs to Kasenge Women's group-Mukono.

loans.use: revamping her grocery store and purchasing more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rwenshama Tukore Group B

texts.en: T. Mauda  is 30 years old and married with four children. She has a fishing business in Rwenshama from which she is able to make 210,000/= as weekly profits. She is trustworthy and supplies her fish to restaurants and hotels in Rukungiri as well as selling to homes. Her dream is to be able to build a good house for her family and improve her business. She needs a loan to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: Buying more fish for resale

loans.name: Riberatha

texts.fr: Riberatha N. est commerçante, choriste, et présidente d’un groupe à l’église.  Elle a 49 ans, elle est célibataire, et elle a fini 3 ans d’école primaire.  Elle a 6 enfants, deux personnes en charge, et un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter en gros des ananas pour les vendre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’élever son stock pour vendre en gros les ananas et autres fruits.  Elle voudrait être un grand distributeur des fruits dans la ville de Kigali, et ajouter un autre article à vendre.  Elle voudrait aussi améliorer le bien être de la famille, et scolariser tous ses enfants et les personnes en charge.
texts.en:
Riberatha N. is a merchant, a choir member, and the president of a church group.  She is 49 years old and unmarried and has completed three years of primary schooling.  She has six children, two persons to support, and one of her children goes to school.  Riberatha is going to use her loan for buying pineapples wholesale in order to resell them.  Her growth strategy for her business is to increase her stock of goods in order to sell pineapples and other fruit in bulk.  

She would like to be a major distributor of fruit in the city of Kigali.  She would also like to improve her family’s well-being and to provide schooling for all her children and the people in her care.

loans.use: Buying pineapples in bulk to sell

loans.name: Michael Mutiso

texts.en:
Michael is 44 years old, married with four children. He has been farming on  his own piece of land  for a period of eight years with a profit of Kshs. 20,000 per month. His spouse contributes to the family income as well.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use it to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes to grow a variety of crops in order to increase his income and to  improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Isaac Nduati

texts.en:
Isaac is 58 years old and married to Scholar who contributes to the family income. He has a dairy farm which he has been running for the past 3 years with an income of about Kshs 5,000 a month.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD and he wants to use it to buy a dairy goat. This, he hopes, will greatly increase his yield and thus his income as well.

He hopes to venture into greenhouse farming to increase his profit so that he will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Patrick

texts.fr: Patrick B. est technicien.  Il a 29 ans, et il est marié.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour préparer pour la maternité de sa femme, et aussi pour améliorer son activité de technicien.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de faire le travail de qualité, respect du date de livraison, et faire les garanties pour ses clients pour bien rembourser son prêt.  Dans le futur,  Il voudrait augmenter son activité de télécommunication et électroniques pour assurer le bien être de sa famille, et aussi entreprendre un projet familial avec sa femme.
texts.en: Patrick B. is a technician.  He is 29 years old and married.  He will use his loan to prepare for the new baby his wife is expecting, and to improve his business.  His strategy for business growth is to do quality work, deliver his work on time, and offer guarantees to his clients.  In the future, he would like to increase his telecommunications and electronics business and also undertake a family project with his wife.

loans.use: Preparation for the motherhood of his wife.

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
Mesrop B. was born in 1963.  He lives in Koti village, in the Ijevan area. Mesrop is married and has 3 daughters. 

From 1980 until 1992, he worked as a driver.  In 1993, he participated in the Nagorno-Karabakh war conflict. After that, from 1994 until now, he has returned to his work as a driver.  At the same time, Mesrop and his wife are engaging in animal breeding and land cultivation.  On their farm they produce butter and cheese, which they sell to their neighbors and distribute at Ijevan city's market.
 
Mesrop wants to develop his swine breeding business and has requested a 500,000 AMD loan to buy pigs and fodder for his farm animals. Mesrop says his farm development will permit him to increase his family’s incomes and improve his family’s living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal fodder

loans.name: Rwenshama Tukore Group C

texts.en: M. James is the leader of Rwenshama Tukore Group in Rukungiri. He is 45 years old and married with five children. He has a bar in Rwenshama that has been in existence for over eight years. He sells beers, waragi (a local brew), and so on, and he needs a loan to buy more beers for resale. James is very hardworking and trustworthy and that is why his customers believe in him. He hopes to buy more land for agriculture in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beers for resale

loans.name: Fredrick Mutunga

texts.en:
Fredrick, age 36, is married to Annastacia and together they have five children who are all in school. He runs a small hotel / food stall in Kiwani, Emali town. Most of his customers are average income earners from the surrounding areas. He has been running this business for 14 years and his income has been good thus far.

Fredrick was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Emali office. This is his third loan from KADET and he intends to use it to buy a better cooking stove and add more kitchenware and foodstuffs like flour, cooking oil and rice to sell to his customers. He hopes to grow his business so that he is able to give his children better education and a good life.

loans.use: To buy a cooking stove, kitchenware and foodstuffs for a food stall

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 


He has a goat meat selling business, selling to his neighbours and at the market to market goers. In addition he operates a retail shop, which contributes to his income. Mgandi faces a major challenge in theft and drought in his business. He hopes to open a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats  for resale

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven O. O. is twenty three years old. He is single and does not yet have children. His business is located in Kisumu near a fish market. Kisumu is the region in Kenya which harbours Lake Victoria.  It is well-known as the Lake's basin. 

Steven provides transport services by use of a bicycle around the busy Kisumu city. He has been in this business for two and half years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is rain.  During the rainy season, business is low since bicycles lack cover from rain and so people don't like to use them. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Steven is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy bicycles to expand his business. He hopes to acquire a motorbike for transport services in the future. He also hopes to have his own family some day. He describes himself as energetic, motivated and respectful.

loans.use: To buy bicycles

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
B. Umaru has had a business selling timber in Kijwiga Mpara for two years. He is 41 years old and married with seven children, all still attending school. His customers are mostly transporters to Kampala that buy at a lower price and sell at a higher price once they get to market. He is able to make 40,000/= in weekly profit, in addition to his other agricultural business. He is grateful that he took the advice of a fellow friend and now he sees and feels the results. He is very hardworking and self-motivated.

Umaru is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He needs a loan to be able to buy more trees for timber production.

loans.use: To purchase more trees for timber production

loans.name: Phoebe Mbatha

texts.en:
Phoebe operates a general store where she sells food items as well as some charcoal for fuel. She is a married woman, age 38, and the mother of two children, who are 17 and 12 years old. They live in Makueni town which is a relatively busy center serving several villages. She has been in her business for the last five years.

Phoebe got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. She has applied for a loan which she plans to use to buy some more wheat flour for 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), sugar for 3,000 KES and charcoal for 10,000 KES to sell. From the profits, Phoebe plans to pay for her children's school fees and add more stock to her shop. She dreams of one day owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La señorita Liz Z. de 22 años de edad, soltera, no tiene hijos, cuenta con un  copetín en su domicilio, conocido en la zona. Empezó hace mas de 1 año con la ayuda de su madre, la misma se encarga del copetín  a las noche puesto que el negocio queda al costado de una cancha de futbol.
Solicito dicho préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de más mercaderías como harina, huevo, carne, leche, gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, etc. para la elaboración de las comidas y también para aumentar su stock. 
Liz al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la fundación paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo ofrecido ya que gracias a eso podrá seguir dando a sus clientes alimentos de buena calidad y al mejor precio, también bebidas y golosinas.
texts.en:
Liz Z. is 22 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She has a small restaurant in her home which is well known in her area.  She started her business more than one year ago with the help of her mother.  She takes care of the restaurant at night since the business is located next to a soccer field.

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy more merchandise such as flour, eggs, meat, milk, soda, juice, beer, etc. so that she can make her meals and also increase her stock.

As she was leaving our offices, Liz thanked Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support she is receiving since it will help her to continue in her business, providing her customers with good quality food at a good price.  She also provides drinks and sweet treats.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, meat, milk, soda, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 31 years old.  He is married and blessed with a five-year-old child.  For a living, he repairs computers and provides Internet access for a fee.  He has been in this business for three years and has managed to employ three people.  He also does farming for extra income.  He hopes to expand his computer business to other towns in the future.  He has requested a loan for 80,000 Kes to buy laptops and network server for field work.

loans.use: To buy laptops and a network server

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señorita Maria Mercedes C. Carballo, es soltera sin hijos, tiene un copetín en el cual vende minutas, golosinas, gaseosas y jugos, el local está ubicado en el predio del Hospital Regional De Villarrica. 
Es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta. La ayuda en su copetín su abuela.
Solicito apoyo crediticio para la compra de mercaderías como harina, huevo, leche, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, para aumentar su stock y también para elaborar los alimentos como empanadas, milanesas, sandwich, etc. porque en esta época empieza a aumentar la demanda, tiene su clientela formada.
La señorita Mercedes agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada porque gracias a eso ella podrá seguir dando a sus clientes productos de buena calidad, y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando el nivel.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes C. Carballo is single and doesn't have any children.  She has a small restaurant in which she sells fast food, sweet treats, soda and juice.  Her premises are located in the grounds of the Regional Hospital of Villarrica.

Mercedes is a very hard-working and honest person.  Her grandmother helps her in her restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as flour, eggs, milk, soda, juice, sweet treats, etc. to increase her stock and also so that she can make food such as empanadas, 'milanesas' (a breaded meat dish), sandwiches, etc. because demand starts to rise during this season.  She already has an established customer base.

Mercedes is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving because it will enable her to continue providing her customers with good-quality products which will, in turn, enable her to continue improving the standard.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, eggs, milk and sweet treats.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 57 years old and married to Beatrice, who contributes to the family income. They have four children aged 27, 23, 20 and 20 years. Samson has been growing crops for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of 6000 Kenya shillings.

This will be his second loan with KADET LTD after having repaid the previous one. Samson hopes to be a leading horticulture farmer and give his children a quality education and improve their living standards

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 


She has been operating a fresh water selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors.  Mary faces a major challenge in  seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the loan for 35,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 37 years old.  She is a mother of three.  She owns a shop where she sells animal feeds.  She omi opened the shop five years ago after leaving her job as a driver.  She is doing well in her business and hopes to improve it.  Naomi also does horticultural farming and runs a retail shop to boost her income.  She has requested a loan for 50,000 Kes to buy a Fresian cow and more animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy a Fresian cow and animal feeds

loans.name: Pamba Group

texts.en:
Romana J., in her early thirties, is married and has two children. Romana has been runing a business selling milk from her one cow for the past year, and she also owns a pool table which she charges customers to use. Operating the business daily from 07:00 am to 10:00 pm earns her a low monthly profit.

This will be Romana's second loan from Tujjenge Tanzania. She used her first loan, since fully repaid, to bring her cow back down to Dar es Salaam. With her second loan, she intends to build a shed in which to house her cow. Romana's dream is to provide good education for her children.

Romana will share this loan with her loan group Pamba, which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Romana is in front holding a baby.

loans.use: To build a shed for her cow.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, tiene 31 años de edad, es empleada de un consultorio médico, vive con su esposo don José Antonio y sus dos hijos, Verónica de 13 y Jonatán de 5 años de edad, residen en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, ella trabaja como secretaria en un consultorio desde hace 3 años, con su sueldo ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Marta está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de Duralita para el techo de su casa, ya que el techo que actualmente tiene esta deteriorado por lo que desea cambiarlo antes de que pueda suceder un accidente domestico, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda y que su familia está más segura.
Sueña con ver a sus hijos crecer y que se gradúen de la universidad para que opten por una vida diferente.
texts.en:
Marta is 31 years old.  She works in a doctor's office and lives with her husband, José Antonio, and her two children, 13 year-old Verónica and 5 year-old Jonatán.  They live in San Miguel, in San Miguel department.

Marta has been working as a medical secretary for three years.  She uses her salary to help her husband with their household expenses.  Marta is requesting this loan so that she can buy corrugated metal sheets for the roof of her house because her current roof is in a bad state of repair and she would like to replace it before there is an accident.  She will use this loan to improve the conditions of her home and to make her family safer.  She dreams of seeing her children grow and graduate from university so that they can choose a different life.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal sheets for the roof of her house

loans.name: Magdalena Asuncion

texts.es: Magdalena de 58 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores y con su propia familia, labora para el MINED como docente desde hace 22 años en la Escuela Nvos Horizontes ubicada en el Sistema Penitenciario de Juigalpa; esta solicitando su credito # 18 y espera seguir siendo beneficiado con el Fondo Kiva para continuar mejorando su casa, esta vez quiere comprar los materiales para construir la sala y el porche de su casa. El mayor sueño de Magdalena es poder terminar su casa pues es el patrimonio de sus hijos. Expresa que cuando cancele este credito solicitara otro para seguir acondicionando su casa.
texts.en: Magdalena is 58 years old, single and has three grown-up children who all have their own families.  She has worked for the Nicaraguan Ministry of Education as a teacher for the past 22 years.  She teaches at the New Horizons School which is located in Juigalpa's prison system.  She is requesting her 18th loan and hopes to continue receiving loans from Kiva so that she can continue improving her home.  This time she would like to buy materials to build her living room and porch.  Magdalena's biggest dream is to be able to finish her house because it is what she will have to leave her children.  She says that when she pays off this loan she will request another so that she can continue improving her house.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 56-year-old farmer.  She sells animal products such as meat and milk.  Mary has been running her business for three years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances.  She hopes to completely educate her last-born child, who is still in school.   She needs a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Leonad

texts.en: Leonad is 37 years old, married to Eunice, and together they have four children. He has rental houses in Kawangware, a very busy and highly populated region. Leonad was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and this will be his second loan; he has never borrowed elsewhere. Having operated the business for the last two years, Leonad intends to use the loan to buy building materials in order to renovate the houses as the New Year begins. He hopes to become a landlord with many houses for rent in the area.

loans.use: To buy some bulding materials in order to renovate rental houses.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a widow with seven children – six had graduated from school while one still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Mbeyu faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for sale. She decided to join to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for sale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 54 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge,cliente de Hope depuis bientôt cinq mois. N'ayant pas pu finir ses études au lycée par manque de moyens, elle se lance dans la vente de poissons fumes qu'elle va acheter dans les régions poissonneuses au nord du pays. 
Elle vend en moyenne 150.000 fr a 300.000frs par semaine.Elle a rembourse son premier prêt avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables..
Avec le second prêt,elle compte renforcer son stock de poisson, acheter différents qualités de poisson en stock considérable pour éviter de voyager chaque semaine.
Tres remarquable par ses services, elle tient a aller loin avec Hope, jusqu'à ce qu'elle atteigne son objectif, ouvrir un grand dépôt de poissons fumes dans un marche de la place
texts.en:
54-year-old young woman, single with 2 children in her care, soon a client of Hope for almost 5 months.  Unable to finish her high school studies due to a lack of means, she started to sell smoked fish that she goes to buy in the fishing areas in the north of the country.  

She sells on average 150,000 fr to 300,000 fr per week. She successfully repaid her first loan and saved a considerable amount.

With the second loan, she intends to strengthen her stock of fish, buying different grades of fish in considerable amounts to avoid traveling each week.  Very remarkable for her services, she wants to go far with Hope, until she reaches her goal of opening a large smoked fish depot in a local market.

loans.use: Purchase of baskets of smoked fish, such as eel, carp, catfish

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 29 years old and married.  He does welding to earn a living.  He says that he is dedicated to his work and hopes to succeed in his business.  Mario looks for customers from people who are undertaking construction work.  With the loan of 20,000 Kes, he will buy steel iron sheet for welding windows and doors.

loans.use: To buy steel iron sheet

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over twenty years, she has operated a retail shop selling to her neighbours and passersby. Saumu faces a major challenge in competition from other vendors. She hopes to expand in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and maize flour for sale

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah N. M. is forty-five years old. She is widowed and has two children, aged fifteen and eight. Her business is located at Kinanie Trading Centre and is known by the name Jaribu shop. She is served by the Kitengela Branch. 

Reginah has a retail shop in which she sells general items.  This is a business she has been running for the last three years. She serves the local people and has one employee. She says that this business is profitable.  The major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business, that customers are not loyal because they have many choices. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to own her own supermarket in the future. She describes herself as very visionary.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Doña María Cristina, de 50 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vende papas fritas, tostadas de plátano y bebidas refrescantes, vive sola por que sus hijos ya son mayores y formaron sus propios hogares, ella ubica el negocio en la terminal de buses ya que es un lugar donde mucha gente que viaja llega hasta ahí para tomar el autobús. 
Ella quiere comprar mercadería para aumentar su venta ya que en momentos tiene poco inventario y prepara poca venta perdiendo tal vez de ganar más, con este préstamo está en la disposición de producir más y ver la posibilidad de tener mejores ganancias, ya que en San Miguel están de fiesta y la movilización de la gente es mayor.
Quiere contar con salud principalmente para desempeñar su trabajo y poder pagar puntualmente el préstamo e ir aumentando su negocio y ganancias.
texts.en:
María Cristina, 50, lives in San Miguel.  She sells potato chips, fried plantain chips and beverages.  She lives alone because her children are grown and have made their own homes.

She has located her business at the bus terminal because it is a place where many travelers come to take the bus.  María Cristina wants to buy merchandise to increase her sales because at times her inventory is low, and her sales are low, so perhaps she is losing out on earning more.  With the loan, she will be able to produce more and possibly have greater earnings, since now is a holiday time in San Miguel and people are traveling more.

Mainly, she wants to be healthy so she can do her job and pay off the loan on time, and so she can make her business and earnings grow.

loans.use: Buy potatoes, plantains, sodas and juices

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr: Beatrice N. est tailleur.  Elle a 31 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a une éducation d’école primaire.  Elle a 3 enfants entre 4 ans et 9 ans, et tous vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter es tôles, ciments, briques, et des portes pour la construction de sa maison.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et elle voudrait acheter 3 machines diversifiée pour son commerce de tailleur.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait avoir l’habitation.
texts.en: Beatrice N. is a tailor. She is 31 years old, widowed, and has a primary school education.  She has 3 children between the ages of 4 and 9. All attend school.  She will use her loan to buy sheet metal, cement, bricks, and doors for the construction of her house. Her business growth strategy is to save, and she would like to buy 3 different machines for her tailoring business. For her family, she would like shelter.

loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal, cement, bricks, and doors for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; ella tiene 48 años de edad es separada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de fruta, la socia tiene su stand en el mercado Virgen Asunta por el centro de la ciudad, la socia es una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Siempre Adelante communal bank, located in the Cusco district that is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Lucila is the member.  She is 48, separated and she has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with buying and selling fruit.  Lucila has a stand in the Virgen Asunta market in the city center.  She is an enterprising woman who really wants to get ahead.

The member is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete all the payments on time.

loans.use:
The member is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise M. W. is a married to a teacher.  She has three children between sixteen and nine years old. Her business is located at a busy market in Kitengela.  It is known as Gatanga Race. She is served by the Kitengela Branch. 

Loise has a retail shop in which she sells general items, including milk, bread, tea leaves, sugar, detergents, cooking oil and other items.   She has run this business for the last one and half years. She serves the local people. She says that this business is profitable.  The major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business, that her customers are not loyal because they have many choices. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to own her own supermarket in the future. She describes herself as very aggressive.

loans.use: To buy sugar, detergents, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Nataly; ella tiene 27 años de edad es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ollas, sartenes, tazas, cubrecamas, sabanas entre otros ella viaja hasta la ciudad de lima para comprar su mercadería y luego lo distribuye a sus clientes que le solicitan la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nataly is a member of the communal bank, "Siempre Adelante" ("Always Moving Forward"). The bank is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Nataly is a 27-year-old single woman with one son. Her work varies from day to day. She buys and sells pots, skillets, cups, bedspreads, and sheets, among other items. She travels to the city of Lima to buy her products and then distributes them to the customers who requested them. Her business does not have a fixed location.

Nataly is requesting this loan in order to buy more merchandise for her business. She is glad to have the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 23-year-old businessman.  He has been operating his barber shop for two years.  He gained experience running his business from working previously in a barber shop.  He is glad that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money with his group members on a weekly basis.  Currently, his barber shop is small and cannot accommodate more than five customers at a time.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to enlarge his business premise and buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: To enlarge business premise and buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo 41 de edad, casado con la señora Isidora de 40 años, tienen 2 hijos, uno de 16 años y otro de 8 años ambos son  estudiantes.
 El señor R. es herrero de profesión que aprendió de su padre, cuenta con taller propio en su casa, ahí realiza todo tipo de trabajo sobre hierro, como verjas, portones, sillas, rejas, tinglados y otros. Su cónyuge se encarga del cuidado de los hijos. 
 Recurrió a Fundación Paraguaya para ayuda crediticia, y gracias a su esfuerzo está logrando todos sus sueños el de poder brindar todas las comodidades a su familia y acceso a la educación. 
     En la ocasión solicita dicha ayuda para la compra de hierros en  cantidad ya que tiene pedidos de 80 sillas para un restaurant.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 41 years old and is married to Isidora, age 40. They have two children who are 16 and 8 years old. Both children are in school. Mr. R. is a blacksmith and learned this trade from his father. He has his own workshop in his house where he works on a wide variety of iron metalworking projects, such as railings, gates, chairs, grilles, and sheds, among other things. His spouse takes care of their children.

He has turned to Fundación Paraguaya for financial assistance. Thanks to them, he is able to realize all his dreams, including his dream of providing his family with a comfortable life and access to education.

He has requested the above-mentioned loan in order to purchase a large quantity of iron as he already has a request from a restaurant for eighty chairs.

loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of iron

loans.name: Juan Leonidas

texts.es:
Don Juan es un señor de 50 años de edad, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán donde vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos Gabriela de 12 años y Melvin de 6 años de edad, don Juan se dedica a la fabricación de hamacas, negocio que atiende en su propia casa y que es la fuente de ingreso para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Hoy día don  Juan solicita un préstamo para hacerle mejoras a la casa comprando láminas para el techo y pagar el mozo para que le ayude a realizar el trabajo,  con este préstamo el lograra contar con una vivienda más segura para compartirla con su familia. Su principal objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios para que estos tengan mejores oportunidades de empleo en el futuro.
texts.en:
Juan is a 50 year old gentleman who lives in San Carlos, Morazán Department, with his wife and two children, Gabriela, 12, and Melvin, 6.  He makes hammocks in his own house and this is the source of income that covers the household expenses.

Juan is currently requesting a loan to make some improvements on his house.  He wants to buy metal sheets for the roof and to pay the worker who is helping him.  This loan will give him a safer house to share with his family.  His main goal is to help his children with their studies so that they will have better job opportunities in the future.

loans.use: To buy metal sheets for the roof

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a widow with two children, one of whom still attends school while the other one has graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. 

She operates a maandazi (East African fried breads) selling business at the market, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Mishi faces a major challenge in seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish rental houses in the future.

With 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and baking powder. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and baking powder

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José, tiene 36 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia y se dedica a la venta y reparación de bicicletas además atiende un negocio de helados, el taller tiene 20 años de existir por lo mismo José tiene ya experiencia en el manejo de  este negocio.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar nuevos estilos de bicicletas así como repuestos para estas, lo que pretende es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes estilos nuevos y repuestos para las bicicletas.
Su objetivo es sostenerse en el mercado, poder establecer un taller competitivo que le genere ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
José, 36, lives in El Transito department of San Miguel.  He lives with his family and sells and repairs bicycles.  He also has an ice cream business.  He has had the shop for 20 years and so José has a lot of experience handling the business.
He is requesting a loan to buy new styles of bicycles and parts for them.  What he would like is to enhance his business and offer his customers new models and parts for the bicycles.

His goal is to remain solid in the market, and establish a competive shop that will generate income for the support of his family.

loans.use: To buy bicycles and parts

loans.name: Bahit

texts.en: Bahit is 42 years old.  He is married and is blessed with three children.  He has been running an electronic workshop for the past ten years.  His business is located in Kibera slums, hence most of his customers are low-income earners.  He has managed to employ one person in his business.  He also owns rental houses, which earns him extra income.  He hopes to buy a piece of land in the future and build his own house.  He has requested a loan of  25,000 Kenyan shillings to connect power to his new workshop.

loans.use: To connect power to new workshop

loans.name: Debora Antonia

texts.es: Debora Antonia tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 13 años que tiene este negocio, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de obtener este medio de vida. Cuando el inicio fue con el apoyo de su esposo pues no tenía los suficientes gastos para sufragar su hogar ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como sabanas, adornos, toallas, perfumes y calzado. Sueña con ampliar su vivienda y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Debora Antonia is 36 years old.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She has had her business for more than 13 years.  She is a very enterprising woman who enjoys her work.  She started her business with her husband's support since he didn't earn enough to cover their household expenses.  Debora Antonia has two dependent children and is requesting a loan to buy products such as sheets, decorations, towels, perfumes and footwear.  She dreams of extending her home and improving her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago de 61 años de edad, casado con la Señora Myrian de 55 años  de edad, tienen  3 hijos, mayores que trabajan en el extranjero, el señor Santiago se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados, empezó realizando la venta llegando a entidades públicas y casas particulares, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación fue logrando salir adelante y gracias a la ayuda de su cónyuge ahora ya cuentan con un local en su casa y desde allí realiza su venta.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo y confianza, con este crédito otorgado realizara la compra de mas mercaderías de temporada como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas y calzados, de esa forma seguir ofreciendo a toda su clientela prendas variadas y al mejor precio.
texts.en: Santiago is 61 years old and married to 55 year-old Myrian.  They have three grown-up children who live abroad.  Santiago sells clothes and footwear.  He started in this business going to sell his products in public companies and private homes.  Through a lot of hard work and commitment he has managed to get ahead and, thanks to his wife's help, he now has a sales location in his home and he sells his products there.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for their support and trust.  He will use this loan to buy more seasonal merchandise such as blouses, dresses, pants, shirts and footwear.  In this way he hopes to continue offering his customers a variety of garments at the best possible price.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants and footwear

loans.name: Akossiwa Egnonam

texts.fr: Egnonam  est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée. Elle est coiffeuse de profession  mais associe la vente des mèches et produit de beauté.
