Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et cumule dans cette activité 3 ans.  Elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner. Elle est née à Lomé et habite adakpamé.
texts.en: Egnonam is 30 years old and married. She is a hairdresser by trade, but in addition she also sells hair extensions and beauty products. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and has three years of experience in the business. She is seeking a loan in order to replenish her stock. She was born in Lomé and lives in Adakpamé.

loans.use: Purchasing beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne A. O. is twenty-nine years old.  She is single and has two children, aged ten and one. Her business is located at Kinanie Trading Centre and is known by the name Carol Boutique. Although she is a tailor, her business is known as a boutique because she makes and sells clothes on her own initiative without waiting for orders from customers. She also makes and repairs clothes according to customers requirements. Her business serves the local people.  She has had this business for ten years and has three employees. 

Carolyne says that this business is profitable and her major challenge is financial contraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more materials to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business, buy her own plot of land and build a residential house. She describes herself as very visionary.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine owns a business selling fish and palm oil.  She has been in this business for eight years.   She is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are between seven and fourteen years old. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Claudine will use her loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to grow her business. Claudine says that she started out small but she has grown and even managed to build a house from the profits of her trade.  She dreams of being a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fish and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia, reside en El Transito departamento de Usulután, tiene 24 años de edad, posee una tienda, vive con su abuela y un tío, es soltera. Esta tienda nació por sus padres y luego la cedieron a ella para que la administrara.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, productos como azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite y pollo que son parte de lo que ofrece a los clientes, con esta inversión espera aumentar el inventario y brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
El objetivo de Claudia es fortalecer el negocio y ser más competente frente a los demás negocios,  atender a un buen número de clientes y prosperar cada día junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in El Transito, in Usulután department.  She is 24 years old, single and owns her own store.  She lives with her grandmother and an uncle.

Claudia's store used to belong to her parents but they gave it to her to run.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, beans, rice, oil and chicken which are some of the products she offers her customers.  Through this investment, she hopes to increase her inventory and provide her customers with a better service.  Claudia's goal is to strengthen her business and become more able to deal with competing businesses.  She would like to serve a good number of customers and prosper every day together with her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, rice, oil and chicken

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.Gladys; ella tiene 47 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de fruta, la socia tiene su puesto en el mercado virgen asunta ahí vende todo tipo de fruta al por mayor y menor,la socia lleva años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y para el revestido de su puesto.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys belongs to the communal bank "Siempre Adelante."  This bank is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Gladys is 47 years old, lives with a partner, and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business buying and selling fruit.  She has a post in the "Virgen Asunta" market where she sells all kinds of fruit at wholesale and retail.  Gladys has had this business for a number of years, and she is feels very content with it.

Gladys requests a loan to buy more merchandise for her business, and to refinish the walls of her stall.

She is very happy to receive this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business, and to refinish the walls of her stall

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a tailoring business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition she operates a boutique which is her other source of income.  Salma faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business.  She hopes to expand and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rosa De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Rosa de 23 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su tía quien la creció, Rosa está soltera y viven en casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de productos empacados, ella tiene dos años de dedicarse al negocio y lo aprendió en su familia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en el negocio y hacerle algunas reparaciones al vehículo de trabajo, con esta ayuda podrá fortalecer el negocio comprando mercadería para ofrecer mejores productos a los clientes, así mismo mejorar la condición de su vehículo que es el medio para transportar la mercadería. 
Las aspiraciones de ella son mejorar su condición económica a través del negocio, contar con salud para seguir trabajando y progresando.
texts.en:
Rosa, 23, lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel.  She lives with an aunt who raised her.  Rosa is single, and they live in their own home.  Rosa has a business selling packaged goods.  She has had this business for 2 years, and she learned this trade from her family.

Rosa is requesting a loan to invest in her business and to make some repairs to the vehicle she uses in her work.  This loan will help her to strengthen her business in two ways: she can buy merchandise so that she can offer better products to her customers; and she can improve the condition of her vehicle, which is her means of transporting her merchandise.

Rosa aspires to improve her financial situation through her business, and hopes to have good health so that she can continue to work and progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and repair her vehicle

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.Ines; ella tiene 43 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de fruta, la socia tiene su puesto en el mercado Virgen Asunta ahí vende todo tipo de fruta al por mayor y menor, la socia lleva años trabajando en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the "Siempre Adelante" (Always Moving Forward) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ines is 43 years old, married and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling fruit.  She has a stall in the Virgen Asunta market where she sells all kinds of fruit wholesale and retail.  She has been working in this business for years and she feels happy because through her business she has managed to get her family ahead in life.

Ines is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and she pledges to make her repayments on tijme.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La señora Simeona D. de Pavón de 47 años de edad, separada, con 2  hijos, cuenta con varias maquinas forrajeras lo cual utiliza para convertir el maíz en harina de maíz para su posterior comercialización en su domicilio, es muy conocido en la zona.
Solicito dicho préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de Maíz por bolsa.
 El mismo al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la fundación paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo ofrecido porque gracias a ello podrá seguir dando a todos sus clientes materia prima de excelente calidad y buen precio y de esa forma mejorar su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en: Simeona D. de Pavón, 47, is separated and has 2 children.  She has a number of fodder machines which she uses to convert corn into corn meal to later sell from her home.  Her business is well-known in the area.  She requests a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya to buy more sacks of corn.  She would like to thank the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support offered, because thanks to this she will be able to continue to give her customers excellent raw materials at a good price, and in this way improve the standard of living of herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk

loans.name: Juana Virginia

texts.es:
Doña Juana, tiene 56 años de edad, posee una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután, tiene casa propia y vive con su esposo; este negocio lo inicio hace 17 años  siendo una pequeña tienda pero que poco a poco fue aumentando.
Ella quiere invertir al negocio y para esto solicita un préstamo para comprar artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pollo y detergentes, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su inventario y ofrecer a los clientes lo necesario para el hogar.
El objetivo de doña Juana es cancelar el préstamo puntualmente y tener un negocio prospero que garantice ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old.  She owns a store where she sells household essentials.  She lives in her own home, with her husband, in Puerto el Triunfo, in Usulután department.  Juana started this business 17 years ago.  Back then it was a small store but she has gradually made it bigger and bigger.

Juana would like to invest in her business and for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy essentials such as rice, sugar, beans, chicken and detergents.  This loan will help her to improve her inventory and offer her clients the basics they need for their homes.  Juana's goal is to pay this loan off punctually and to have a prosperous business that guarantees income for her household.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, chicken and detergents

loans.name: Cesarie

texts.en:
Cesarie is 48 years old, married and has four children who range in age from nine to twenty-four years old.  Currently, four of her children are enrolled in school.  Cesarie sells metals, which she has done for three years.  She works together with her husband in the business.  

Cesarie will use the loan to purchase more metals and timbers.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Cesarie plans to set up a hardware store.  She dreams of owning her own house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more metals and timber to sell.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne owns a retail store  that sells a variety of items like sugar, rice, cooking oil, and many home use products.  She is 41 years old and is no longer with her husband.  She has five children who are between eight and eighteen years old.  All of her children go to school. 

Julienne has been selling items in her store for seven years.  Her loan will be used add more merchandise to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a home.  She would also like to be a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To be used to add more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a groundnuts sales business for the past three years, selling in a shop and from door to door to her neighbours and school age children.  Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to establish a food stall in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan she wants to purchase two sacks of ground nuts for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr.Edmundo; el tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papas el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja siendo esta la que administra el negocio, a la vez el socio administra el servicio público de baño del mercado Virgen Asunta en el mismo que se encuentra su otro negocio el socio está muy contento ya que con el préstamo el podrá implementar mas su negocio.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su negocio de venta de papas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen Natividad communal bank that is located in the Urubamba district that is part of the Urubamba province in Cusco department.
He is Edmundo, 47, in a common-law marriage and he has 5 children.  The member alternates his daily activities by selling potatoes with his partner.  She manages this business and he  takes care of the public bathrooms in the Virgen Asunta market.  Their business is also located in this market.  He is very happy with the loan because this will allow him to improve the business.

The member is requesting a loan to buy more products for his potato sales business.

He is very content with the loan and promises to make all of the payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy more products for his potato sales business.

loans.name: José David Everinos

texts.es:
José David, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, tiene 25 años de edad, reside en Yoloaiquin departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa y una hija de un año de edad, José lleva 10 años de dedicarse al cultivo de hortalizas trabajando para un vecino, pero desde hace 4 años se ha dedicado a sembrar en lo propio chile, tomates, ejotes y pepino.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono orgánico y tratamiento para plagas, este préstamo le permitirá contar con lo necesario para poder sembrar y aumentar el área de producción obteniendo mayor cantidad de frutos, además tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecer productos frescos a los clientes.
Su objetivo es tener una buena cosecha, poder venderla a buen precio y generar ingresos para su familia, uno de sus sueños es que su hija pueda crecer sanamente y logre ser profesional.
texts.en:
José David is a vegetable farmer. He is 25 years old and lives in Yoloaiquin in the Morazán department with his wife and his 1-year-old daughter. José has been growing vegetables for a neighbor for ten years now. Four years ago, he began planting chili peppers, tomatoes, green beans, and cucumbers on his own property. 

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase farm supplies such as chemical and organic fertilizers and pest control treatment. This loan will help him to obtain the supplies he needs in order to plant his crops and to expand the area that he cultivates, thereby increasing his yield. This will give him the opportunity to offer fresh produce to his customers.

His goal is to obtain a good harvest so that he can sell it at a decent price and generate income for his family. One of his dreams is that his daughter will be able to grow up healthy and one day get a good job.

loans.use: Purchase of chemical and organic fertilizers and pest control treatment

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old, married and has four children.  Currently, all four of her children go to school.  Josephine sells soft drinks like sodas and tea, which she has been doing for 10 years and her husband is a TV technician.  

Josephine will use the loan to increase the capacity of her business.  With the new profits from her growing business, Josephine plans to reinvest in her soft drink sales to continue to grow her revenue.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose owns a small business that sells vegetables.   She is 37 years old, married, and has three children between three and ten years old.  She also cares for another child.  Her husband is a driver. 

Speciose has been selling vegetables for two years and would like to use her loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to make a bigger store for vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is 32 years old, married and has five children. Currently, four of her children go to school. Josiane has a motorcycle that she rents out for transportation, which she has been doing for 11 years.  Her husband is a driver. 

Josiane will use this loan to purchase more motorcycles.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Josiane plans to buy a vehicle. In the future she would like to have a enough profits to own many more vehicles.

loans.use: To buy more than two motorcycles for transportation.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal owns a business selling clothes, which she had been doing for two years. She is 28 years old, married and has three children. Her husband currently works as a sewage operator.  

Chantal will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes to use any profits she makes to buy many houses.  She has already been able to build her own house because her business has done so well.  In the coming years she would like to import more clothing and some classic styles which she thinks will sell well.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, de 22 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su abuela y está soltero, él administra una tienda  de donde obtiene ingresos para los gastos de él y su abuela, Edwin desde pequeño aprendió a vender lo que le ha permitido mantenerse con la tienda y cuenta ya con experiencia.  Él necesita invertir en mercadería ya que por momentos su inventario se vuelve débil y no alcanza a cubrir la demanda de los clientes, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para el hogar como, aceite, azúcar, arroz, pastas, detergentes, estos son algunos de los productos demandados en su negocio, por tal razón a decidido realizar compras y aumentar el inventario.
Su objetivo es tener los recursos necesarios para evitar que su negocio decaiga  y que por el contrario pueda mantenerse surtida de productos para los clientes y mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
Edwin is 22 years old and resides in El Transito, San Miguel department.  He is single and lives with his grandmother. Edwin operates his own store and obtains income for his and his grandmother's expenses. Since he was little he has been learning to sell, and that has permitted him to maintain himself with his store. He can count on that experience.

Edwin needs to invest in merchandise. At present, his stock is weak and insufficient to meet the demands of his customers. For that reason, he is requesting a loan to buy household products, like cooking oil, sugar, rice, pasta, and detergent. These are just some of the products in demand at the store, for which reason he wishes to make purchases and increase inventory.

Edwin's objective is to have the resources necessary to avoid the store's decline. On the contrary, he intends to maintain the supply of products for his customers and improve his service.

loans.use: TO BUY COOKING OIL, SUGAR, RICE, PASTA, AND DETERGENT TO SELL

loans.name: Donathille

texts.en:
Donathille is a 58 year old widow and has eight children.  She also cares for three other dependents. Currently, eight of her children attend school.  Donathille sells foodstuffs, which she has done for 30 years. 

Donathille will use the loan to purchase foodstuffs, such as sweet potatoes and beans, to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Donathille plans to continue to grow her business, and she hopes to buy a car for business purposes in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Saida; ella tiene 19 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia es ama de casa se dedica al cuidado de su bebe siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento, la socia tiene muchas ganas de estudiar una carrera profesional solo espera que su hijo sea más grande para poder empezar a estudiar.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche entre otras cosas mas y tambien para prestar a su hermano que necesita.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the "Siempre Adelante" ("Always Moving Forward") communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district in Cusco province, department of Cusco.

The name of this bank member is Saida. She is 19 years old, lives with her partner, and has one son. She is a housewife who stays home to take care of her baby. While this is her only occupation right now, she would love to study for a professional career. She is waiting for her son to get a bit older so that she can begin her studies.

This bank member has requested the loan in order to buy basic food products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other things. She will also use the loan to lend her brother the money that he needs.

This bank member is happy about this loan and has committed herself to paying it back.

loans.use: This bank member has requested the loan in order to buy basic food products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other things. She will also use the loan to lend her brother the money that he needs.

loans.name: Asina

texts.en:
Asina is a single woman with six children, two of whom attend school while four completed school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a Khanga's(Kikoi's) selling business for the past three years, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. Asina faces a major challenge of seasonality. During holiday seasons, the demand for Khanga's is very high, while the months of January to August the demand is very low. She hopes to establish a boutique shop in the future.

With 20,000 KES she wants to purchase 30 pieces of Khanga's ( Kikoi's) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 30 pieces of Khanga's (Kikoi's ) for sale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 40 years old, married and has three children who are between the ages of eight months and fifteen years old. Currently, the oldest of her children attends school.  Justine sells fruits, which she has done for 12 years and her husband works with her. 

Justine will use the loan to purchase more fruits to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Justine plans to resolve the basic needs at home and raise her children in a better life.  She wants to own a big boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 30 years old, married and has three children who are between the ages of two and five years old.  Her husband is a bar owner.  Charlotte owns a business that sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for four years.  

Charlotte plans to use her loan to buy more beans, potatoes, and bananas.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand and grow the business.  She also hopes to buy a house to be used for renting and as a new means of generating income.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Jose Misael

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 51 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de verduras y granos básicos, él vive junto a su hijo.
Este negocio fue iniciativa propia, tiene más de 10 años de existir, su horario de atención es de 5:00am a 3:00pm, está ubicado en el mercado municipal de EL Transito, por el momento don José desea comprar verduras y granos básicos como frijol, arroz, tomates, papas, esta compra le dará estabilidad al negocio e incrementara la posibilidad de crecer con las ventas y de ser más rentable.
El objetivo de don José es mantener el negocio por largo tiempo, generar ganancias para el hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 51 and lives in El Transito department of San Miguel together with his son. He sells vegetables and basic grains.

He began this business himself more than 10 years ago.  He works from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm in the business that is located in the municipal market of El Transito.  Now he would like to buy vegetables and grains such as beans, rice, tomatoes, and potatoes.  This purchase will stabilize his business and increase the possibility of his being able to improve sales and become more profitable.
José’s goal is to keep the business for a long time and generate enough income for his home and  to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de todo tipo de grano seco como maíz, chuño entre otros, también cuenta con su propio molino haciendo que esto le facilite el trabajo , la socia lleva años trabajando en este negocio, ella trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the 'Siempre Adelante' (Always Moving Forward) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Marina is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling all kinds of dried grains such as corn and 'chuño' (traditional freeze-dried potato).  She also has her own mill which makes her work easier.  She has been working in this business for years.  She works with her partner and, in this way, gets her family ahead in life.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy products for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Maria Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Yanet; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de librería, ella vende libros, cuadernos, lapiceros y lápices, ella atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la librería.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Yanet is a member of the "Maquimanta Purisun" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Maria Yanet is 35 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She divides her time between her bookstore business where she sells books, exercise books, pens and pencils.  She serves in her store from 9.00am to 6.00pm.  Through her business she has managed to get her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand and improve her business.

Maria Yanet is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her bookstore.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her bookstore

loans.name: Rita Enrique

texts.es:
Rita, reside en Jocoaitique departamento de Morazán, tiene 38 años, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposo de 43 años de edad, él es un lisiado de guerra, tiene siete hijos de 19, 17, 13, 11, 8, 6 y 1 año de edad, todos son dependientes.
Después de los acuerdos de paz Rita y su esposo se dedicaron a la vida productiva, obtuvieron sus tierras para cultivar maíz, café y crianza de cerdos, este ha sido su oficio desde hace ya mucho tiempo,   Por el momento ella solicita un préstamo para comprar cerdos y para la recolección de tres manzanas de café, este préstamo le ayudara a aumentar el número de animales para el crecimiento y engorde.
Doña Rita tiene un sueño y es ver a sus hijos superarse profesionalmente para que puedan optar por un estilo de vida diferente.
texts.en:
Rita lives in Jocoaitique, in Morazán department.  She is 38 years old and her business is raising pigs.  She lives with her 43 year-old husband who is a disabled veteran.  They have seven children aged 19, 17, 13, 11, 8, 6 and 1 who are all still in her care. 

After the peace agreements, Rita and her husband committed themselves to a productive life.  They obtained their land for growing corn and coffee and raising pigs.  This has been Rita's business for a long time.  She is currently requesting a loan so that she can buy pigs and harvest three 'manzanas' of coffee (approximately five acres).  This loan will help her to increase the number of animals she has to raise and fatten.

Rita's dream is to see her children improve themselves professionally so that they can choose a different style of life.

loans.use: To buy pigs and harvest coffee

loans.name: Bururuma Progressive Group

texts.en: Deborah K. is the leader of the Bururuma Progressive Group in Kihihi. She is 40 years old and married, and she has five children, all of whom are older than nine. She has a business selling alcohol, that is, tonto and waragi from Nyamirambi, to the local people in her area. Deborah has been in this business for 6 years, in addition to farming, which is her mother business. She does not regret adding this business, because she is able to make over 240,000/= (Kenyan shillings) in profit each month. She makes the brew herself and sometimes sells the excess because there is a ready market. She needs a loan to buy bananas, which are a primary ingredient in the brew. She is very determined and focused and wants to expand her business further so she can have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy bananas to make the local brew

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: El señora Mirian dedicada a la venta de animales y leche que producen sus vacas esta actividad lo realiza durante toda la semana  siendo este trabajo bastante sacrificado ya que debe de ordeñar la leche desde muy tempranas horas y lleva sus animalitos a la venta los días de feria es así como la señora y su esposo trabajan juntos para poder mantener su familia, este crédito desean para comprar chachos y comercializarlos a fin de año ya que para estas época de año nuevo se acostumbra a comer lechón al horno ya que dice que es de buena suerte para iniciar el año, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mirian's business is selling animals and also the milk that her cows produce.  She does this work all week.  The work demands quite a lot of sacrifice as she must milk her cows very early in the morning and take her animals to market on market days.  Mirian and her husband work together to support their family.

Mirian would like this loan to buy pigs that she can sell at the end of the year since, during the new year period, it is traditional to eat roasted suckling pig.  This is considered to bring good luck for the new year.  Mirian is a very hard-working person and she is grateful to the institution for the support she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Janet; ella tiene 27 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de peluquería ella realiza todo tipo de corte de cabello, tanto para mujeres y varones también realiza tientes, manicure y pedicura entre otros servicios más, la socia está muy contenta con su negocio ya que trabaja en lo que le gusta y así tiene tiempo para estar con su hijo para verlo y estar con él.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su peluquería.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Janet is a member of the 'Siempre Adelante' (Always Moving Forward) community bank which is located Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Janet is 27 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her hairdressing business.  Janet provides different styles of haircut, for both women and men.  She also colors hair and provides manicures, pedicures and other services.  She is very happy with her business since she is working in a job she likes and she also has time to spend with her son, to see him and be with him.

Janet is requesting this loan to keep her hairdressing salon running.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep her hairdressing salon running

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan de 40 años, trabaja en las noches como comerciante de mariscos y en la mañana confecciona y cose ropa. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabaja durante 15 años para poder mantener a su familia. 

Desde pequeño él comenzó con las ventas de mariscos para tener sus propios ingresos, poco a poco con la lista de clientes que tenia por las ventas de mariscos pudo promocionar sus servicios como confeccionista. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano terminando los pedidos de ropa y en las noches vende mariscos de todo tipo recorriendo las calles. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas para su negocio de costura y mejorar su viviendo comprando materiales de construcción. Uno de sus objetivos en el futuro es tener cuartos de alquiler para generar más ingresos y que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old.  He works nights as a seafood vendor.  In the mornings he sews and makes clothes.  He lives in a peri-urban area called Perimetral and has been working for 15 years to support his family.

Juan started selling seafood when he was young so that he could have his own income.  Little by little, through the customer base he had for his seafood business, he was able to promote his services as a dressmaker.  He currently starts work very early in the morning, finishing off clothes orders, and then he sells all kinds of seafood in the evenings as an itinerant street vendor.

Juan would like to use his loan to buy fabric for his dressmaking business and to improve his home, buying building materials.  One of his goals for the future is to have rooms to rent out so that he can make more income so that his daughter doesn't want for anything.

loans.use: To buy fabric and building materials

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos, ella prepara diferentes desayunos como quinua con leche, manzana entre otros desayunos, ella trabaja desde las 4:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de desayunos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para hacer los desayunos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina belongs to the "Maquimanta Purisun" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Luz Marina is 42 years old.  She is single and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling breakfasts.  She prepares different breakfasts such as quinoa with milk, apple, and other breakfasts.  She works from 4.00am to 11.00pm.  She would like to improve her business and is requesting this loan to buy products for making her breakfasts.

Luz Marina is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for making her breakfasts

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de anticuchos y venta de granos secos, la socia vende los granos secos en las distintas ferias de San Sebastián y lo anticuchos también lo vende en los anticuchos en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de anticuchos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos secos como quinua, trigo y maíz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the 'Maquimanta Purisun' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Justina is 55 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling 'anticuchos' (kebabs) and dried grains.  Justina sells dried grains in the different markets of San Sebastián and she sells her kebabs as an itinerant street vendor.  She would like to improve her kebab business.  She is requesting this loan to buy dried products such as quinoa, wheat and corn.

Justina is happy to be receiving this loan and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy dried products such as quinoa, wheat and corn

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Julia; ella tiene 47 años. La socia es conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos  la socia se dedica a vender auto partes de vehículos, la socia tiene su pequeña tienda y vende auto partes, ella viaja a la ciudad de Lima y  Puno a comprar repuestos, accesorios, cobertores de autos, luces entre otros. La socia desea a futuro alquilar una tienda más grande para albergar su negocio y también hacer un espacio para su segunda actividad;  La socia también trabaja de forma ambulatoria en casa vendiendo ropa, ella tiene ropa para vender de mujeres y niños, la socia trae también de la ciudad de Lima, La socia desea el préstamo para poder viajar y traer ropa de invierno desde la ciudad de Lima, porque allá están entrando a la estación de verano. La socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y traer ropa de Lima, junto a alguna mercadería para su tienda de repuestos de autos. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the 'Qorichuspa' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Julia is 47 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children.  She works selling vehicle spare parts.  She has a small store where she sells spare parts.  She travels to the cities of Lima and Puno to buy spare parts, accessories, car covers, lights, etc.

In the future, Julia would like to rent a larger store for her business and would also like to make space for her second business activity.  As well as selling spare parts, Julia works as an itinerant street vendor, working door to door, selling clothes.  She sells women's and children's clothes.  She also buys her clothes in the city of Lima.

Julia would like this loan so that she can travel to Lima and bring back winter clothes because they are entering the summer season there.  Julia is requesting her loan to travel to Lima to buy clothes and also some merchandise for her auto spare parts store.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To travel to Lima to buy clothes as well as some merchandise for her auto spare parts store

loans.name: William Humberto

texts.es:
William Humberto P. S. es un comerciante que aprendió en sus trabajos anteriores la técnica de reparar relojes. A sus 25 años de edad las pocas oportunidades laborales en Yarumal, municipio del Norte de Antioquia de donde es oriundo, lo obligaron a convertirse en comerciante. 

Una vitrina pequeña, una silla, sus manos y algunos implementos básicos para iniciar con las reparaciones, fueron el inicio de lo que hoy es su trabajo, pues a la entrada de una cafetería en una zona comercial, es donde William presta sus servicios. 

Su deseo de salir adelante lo ha impulsado a trabajar fuertemente pues espera ampliar su negocio reparando no sólo relojes sino también celulares, vendiendo accesorios relacionados y generando empleo mínimo a dos técnicos, así mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
William Humberto P. S. is a businessman who learned how to repair watches at previous jobs. At the age of 25, the lack of employment opportunities in Yarumal, the municipality in Northern Antioquia where he lives, forced him to open his own business. 

He started what is now his repair business with just a small glass display case, a chair, his hands and some basic tools. He offers his services at the entrance to a local eatery in a commercial area. 

His dream of getting ahead in life has driven him to work hard, and he hopes to expand his business in order repair both watches and cell phones, sell related accessories and create jobs for at least two technicians. In this way, he will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase tools and equipment with which to repair watches

loans.name: Tubiburukundo Group

texts.en:
Joselyne is 38 years old and married to a soldier.  They have two children who do not attend school yet.  Joselyne is a group leader of a borrowing group called Tubiburukundo in Kinyarwanda which means “Sow love” in English.  Each group member does a different business but all of them know about the functionality of the loan and are willing to pay back the loan because they are confident of their businesses. 

Joselyne sells different items in her shop such as sugar, maize flour, and other retail items that are constantly demanded by her customers.  It’s from this point that Joselyne and her group decided to request a loan particularly for increasing the volume of items in her shop.  She plans on using the profits to pay school fees because her children by will be enrolled in school next year.  She also plans on saving the remaining balance.  She would like to see her business booming by as much as 70% in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale.

loans.name: Sor Ivel

texts.es:
Cuando hablamos con Sor Ivel G. O. se evidencia la pujanza de una mujer luchadora que a sus 24 años y como madre cabeza de hogar de su hijo de 6 se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para responder ante las obligaciones que implica ser madre y padre.  

En Yarumal, municipio ubicado al norte de Antioquia, Sor Ivel recorre las diferentes casas realizando domicilios de manicure, pedicure, cortes de cabello, maquillaje y otros servicios relacionados con la belleza, arte que aprendió gracias a un curso realizado y que fue perfeccionando en una sala de belleza en la que trabajó algún tiempo. 

Tener su propia sala de belleza, y adquirir un tocador, plancha para el cabello, tratamientos y otros utensilios para mejorar y ampliar sus servicios es el deseo de esta madre cabeza de familia que espera brindarle un prometedor futuro a su hijo, razón por la que se levanta cada mañana con la esperanza de atender cada vez más clientes.
texts.en:
When Interactuar staff spoke with Sor Ivel G. O., they noticed the determinedness of a strong woman who at the age of 24, as the head of her household and mother to a 6-year-old boy, found herself obliged to work in order to confront the responsibilities involved with being both mother and father to her child.

In Yarumal, a municipality located in northern Antioquia, Sor Ivel travels from house to house giving manicures, pedicures, haircuts, makeup jobs and other beauty services. She learned this art through a course she took, and perfected her technique at a beauty salon where she used to work. 

She would like to have her own beauty salon and acquire a dressing table, hair straightener, treatments and other tools with which to improve and expand her business. This single mother hopes to provide her son with a promising future; this is why she wakes up each morning with the hopes of serving more and more clients.

loans.use: A hair straightener, nail polish and hair treatments

loans.name: Nelly Nohemy

texts.es: Nelly Nohemy M. D. L. D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Atiquizaya, en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, en donD. vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 12 y 9 años D. edad. Nelly es una persona muy confiable y responsable con su familia, ya que a pesar que su esposo tiene un trabajo estable, ella posee una venta D. ropa, zapatos, frazadas y cortinas, las cuales comercializa en su casa D. habitación, así mismo venD. sus productos D. forma ambulante, lo cual le permite contar con más ganancias para ayudar económicamente a su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. zapatos, ropa y frazadas, las cuales pueda comercializar en mayores cantidades para este fin D. año, y así D. esta forma tener más capital para invertir aún más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelly Nohemy M. D. L. is 38 years old.  She lives in Atiquizaya, in Ahuachapán department, with her husband and two children aged 12 and 9.  Nelly is a very trustworthy person who is very responsible towards her family since, in spite of the fact that her husband has a stable job, she owns a business selling clothes, shoes, blankets and drapes which she sells from her home.  She also sells her products as an itinerant street vendor, which allows her to make more income to help her husband financially.

Nelly is requesting this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of shoes, clothes and blankets which she will be able to sell in larger quantities during this end-of-year season and thereby have more capital to invest even more in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
María Cecilia H. P. es de procedencia campesina, su microempresa de trayectoria familiar de cría de cerdas para la venta ha sido su sustento durante años, aunque hace algún tiempo su negocio se derrumbó cuando se vio obligada a vender lo que tenía para pagar el sepelio de su hijo mayor. 

Aunque para María Cecilia este fue un golpe duro de la vida, la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus otros tres hijos la obligó a empezar de nuevo y rehacer su microempresa. Actualmente sigue trabajando en su hogar, lugar donde tiene la oportunidad de criar las cerdas y recibir las ganancias de la venta de las mismas. 

Esta emprendedora necesita del apoyo económico para comprar una cerda con sus respectivos cerdos pequeños, así podrá engordarlos y venderlos en poco tiempo, puesto que con las ganancias espera tener la oportunidad de arreglar el techo de su casa, ya que con la temporada invernal que asota el país se ha visto afectada. 

A futuro, María Cecilia anhela tener un corral con gran cantidad de cerdos con el fin de vivir con la tranquilidad que le genera una microempresa sólida.
texts.en:
María Cecilia H. P. comes from the countryside. For years, she has earned her living through her family's microenterprise raising pigs, though some time ago the business fell apart when she had to sell what she had in order to pay for the burial of her oldest son. 

Though this was a difficult blow in María Cecilia's life, the need to help her remaining three children get ahead in life drove her to start from scratch and rebuild her small business. Currently, she works from home, where she has the opportunity to raise her pigs and take in the income she earns from selling the pigs. 

This enterprising woman needs economic support to buy a sow and her piglets so that she can fatten them up and sell them within a short period of time. With the profit, she hopes to fix the roof of her house, which has been affected by the winter season that is currently battering the country. 

In the future, María Cecilia dreams of having a large corral with many pigs, in order to achieve the peace of mind generated by having a solid business.

loans.use: Buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of wholesale corn in order to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio G. Bogado es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Republicano , tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Juana Bautista Dominguez de G., con 43 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 2 hijos menores todos en edad escolar.
 
       Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con nosotros y con otras entidades financieras, Ademas se dedica en la Agricultura y Ganadería, tiene 10 Has. Finca con producción agrícola bien diversificados, ganados vacunos.

             El cliente con este crédito va comprar mercaderías para la venta en estas fiestas de Navidad y Año Nuevo  y así tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Antonio G. Bogado is from the city of San Estanislao, in the Republicano neighborhood.  He is 48, married to Juana Bautista Dominguez de G., 43, and they have 2 young school-age children 

He has a store in his home with regular customers, a good income and a good commercial and personal reputation.  He is very hard-working, and is an excellent client with us and with other financial institutions.  He also works in farming and cattle-raising with a ranch of 10 hectares of diverse crops, and beef cattle.

He will use the loan to buy merchandise for the upcoming Christmas and New Years holidays and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, flour, mate, and noodles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy material for making fishing nets

loans.name: Johana Margarita

texts.es:
Johana de 24 años, es estilista ambulante hace 3 años atrás. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral a trabajado haciendo pedicura, manicura y cortes de cabello. 

Ella ha trabajado como estilista ambulante para poder mantener a su hijo de 7 años que estudia en una escuela fiscal. Su trabajo lo realiza llegando a la casa del cliente y llevando sus instrumentos de trabajo realiza lo que le piden. Una de las complicaciones que tiene al salir a trabajar es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive. 

Ella quiere seguir prosperando y con esfuerzo darle una buena vida a su hijo por eso quiere tener un comedor y comenzar con el préstamo comprando víveres de primera necesidad para vender los platos de comida. En el futuro quiere tener un local para ubicar su comedor y tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
24 year-old Johana has been an itinerant stylist for 3 years.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Perimetral and she works providing pedicures, manicures and hair cuts.

Johanna works as an itinerant stylist to support her 7 year-old son who is studying in a state school.  She travels to her customers' houses with her work tools and carries out whatever service they request.  One of the complications that she has in going out to work is the crime that exists in her area.

Johana would like to continue prospering and, through her hard work, provide a good life for her son.  For this reason, she would like to open an eatery and use this loan to start buying some essential foodstuffs so that she can make and sell meals.  In the future, she would like to have premises for her eatery and also own her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth C. D. V. D. 28 años D. edad, es una madre D. familia muy responsable, quien cuida mucho D. su hogar el cual esta conformado por su esposo y dos hijos D. 9 y 2 años D. edad, junto a los cuales resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad. Sandra posee un molino y así mismo su propia tienda en la cual comercializa productos varios como golosinas, pan, papel higiénico, pastillas y algunos tipos D. detergentes, a pesar que ya cuenta con 8 años D. experiencia, debido a que la mayoría D. ganancias son destinas al sostenimiento del hogar, ella invierte muy poco al negocio, por lo que necesita una ayuda para mejorarlo. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad, D. manera que sus clientes tengan mayor variedad para escoger y así comprar más, D. esta misma forma desea contar con el dinero necesario para brindarle un mejor mantenimiento a sus molinos. Sandra es una persona muy dedicada a lo que hace, es por ello que su mayor deseo es poder crecer en su negocio y así mismo brindar un mejor servicio en el cual sus clientes se sientan cómodos y D. esta manera ella pueda mejorar sus ganancias, lo cual sería D. gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth C. D. V. is 28 years old.  She is a very responsible mother who looks after her household very well.  Her household consists of her husband and her two children aged 9 and 2.  The family live together in Ciudad Arce, in La Libertad department.

Sandra has a mill and also her own store in which she sells different products such as candy, bread, toilet paper, sweets and some types of detergent.  In spite of the fact that she has 8 years of experience, owing to the fact that most of her profits are used to support her household, she invests very little in her business.  This is why she needs help to improve it.

Sandra is requesting a loan from Integral which will give her the money she needs to buy a larger quantity of essential household products so that her customers have a larger variety of products from which to choose and will, therefore, buy more.  She would also like to have the money she needs to do maintenance work on her mills.  Sandra is a person who is very committed to what she does.  For this reason, her greatest dream is to be able to grow her business and thereby proviD. a better service with which her customers feel comfortable.  This will allow her to improve her profits which will be of great benefit to her family.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on her mills and to invest in her store

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sara Nohemy

texts.es: Sara Nohemy T. D. P. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en Colón, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive únicamente junto a su esposo quien trabaja para una empresa privada. Sara posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder algunas ventas, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio. Francisca es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella y su hogar, ya que para ella es muy importante poder aportar a su casa y D. esta forma poder vivir D. una manera tranquila en la cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para su esposo y ella.
texts.en:
Sara Nohemy T. D. P. is 37 years old.  She lives in Colón, in La Libertad department with her husband who works for a private company.

Sara owns a store where she sells perishables.  The store is located in her home and allows her to have everything she needs for her household.  She is requesting a loan that will allow her to have the money she needs to fit out her business with everything she needs to proviD. a better service to her customers since she often has to miss out on sales because she doesn't have the products that customers are asking for.  She would like to change this situation, to improve and to get ahead in her business.  Sara is a very visionary lady who always wants to get ahead and grow day by day for her own well-being and that of her family.  For Sara, it is very important to be able to contribute to her household and thereby be able to live more peacefully and have everything she needs for her husband and herself.

loans.use: To buy perishables

loans.name: Carmen Estela

texts.es: Carmen Estela P. P. de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo de 9 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar, junto a ellos reside en Colón, en el departamento de La Libertad. Carmen cuenta con un comedor en el que se encarga de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa pupusas y otros platillos típicos que vende durante la tarde. Su negocio esta muy bien ubicado ya que se encuentra en la plaza principal de Lourdes Colón en donde cuenta con gran cantidad de clientes. Carmen solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: verduras, granos básicos, legumbres, bebidas, platos y vasos desechables y todo lo necesario para mejorar su negocio y así aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es lo principal para ella ya que de esta forma podrá brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Estela P. P. is 32 years old.  She lives together with her husband and 9 year-old child, who is studying, in Colón, in La Libertad department.

Carmen has an eatery in which she prepares breakfasts and lunches.  She also sells 'pupusas' (thick corn tortillas with a savory filling) and other traditional meals that she sells in the afternoon.  Her business is very well positioned since it is in the main square, Plaza de Lourdes, in Colón and she has a large number of customers.

Carmen is requesting a loan so that she can buy: greens, basic grains, vegetables, drinks, disposable plates and cups and everything she needs to improve her business and thereby increase her sales which is key for her since this is how she can provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, drinks, etc. for making meals

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa Elena G. D. O. D. 43 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo en Lourdes Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella posee un chalet en el cual comercializa golosinas, bebidas, alimentos, frutas, agua embotellada y otros productos más, su negocio se encuentra dentro D. un colegio, por lo que sus ventas son muy estables, así mismo no tiene ningún tipo D. competencia por lo que es un negocio bastante rentable, durante los tiempos D. vacaciones escolares, sus ventas se mantienen gracias a los cursos D. verano que algunos alumnos realizan. Rosa solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. comprar mayor cantidad D. productos alimenticios así como también diferentes tipos D. bebidas, D. esta manera ella podrá brindar diferentes precios lo cual le permita contar con más clientes, lo cual será D. mucho beneficio para ella y su hogar.
texts.en: Rosa Elena G. D. O.  is 43, and lives with her husband in Lourdes Colón in La Libertad Department.  She has a stand where she sells candies, drinks, food, fruit, bottled water and other products.  The business is located insiD. a school which make her sales stable.  She has no competition so her business is very solid.  During school vacations she continues to do well because of summer courses that some students take.  Rosa is requesting a loan to buy more food products and also different kinds of drinks.  This way she can offer better prices and thus have more customers so that she better benefits herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy candies, drinks and other food products

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Joel Alberto

texts.es: Joel Alberto T. C. de 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y una hija, con quienes reside Jiquilisco en el departamento de Usulután. Él es un padre muy responsable el cual desea con todo su corazón brindarles una mejor vida a su hija y a su esposa. Joel posee un taller en el cual se dedica a reparar bicicletas, y así mismo a vender accesorios para estas. Joel es muy conocido en la zona ya que elabora un muy buen trabajo y así mismo a precios bajos por lo que la mayoría de personas lo prefieren. Él solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar todo lo necesario para equipar su taller como herramientas, rines, llantas, espejos, luces y otros accesorios más. Todo esto lo hace con el enorme deseo de salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Joel Alberto T. C. is 27 years old, and lives with his wife and one daughter. They live in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután. He is a very responsible father, and he wishes with all of his heart to offer a better life for his daughter and his wife. Joel has a workshop where he repairs bicycles, and also sells accessories for bikes. Joel is very well-known in the region since he does very good work, and his prices are low, so the majority of the people prefer him.

He is requesting a loan from Integral so that he can buy everything necessary to equip his shop, such as: tools, bicycle rims, bicycle tires, mirrors, lights, and other accessories. He does all of this with a great desire to get ahead and have a better life.

loans.use: To buy tools to repair bicycles

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Pablo de 40 años, es un hombre trabajador que con esfuerzo y dedicación hace 6 años atrás comenzó a trabajar con poco capital como ebanista de muebles.  Poco a poco fueron incrementando las ventas de los muebles que elaboraba. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabajado y lo han conocido como ebanista ya que trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm. Para tener más ingresos también tiene una pequeña tienda en la ventana de su casa donde trabaja con ayuda de su esposa ya que tiene tres hijos pequeños de 13, 10 y 2 años que estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Para seguir en el negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo madera, materiales para tener una producción de muebles alta. Uno de sus objetivos es establecer en el centro de la ciudad un taller de ebanista y tener así mayor demanda de sus muebles.
texts.en:
Pablo is 40 years old and is a very hard-working man. Six years ago, with effort and dedication, he began working with a little bit of capital as a furniture-maker. Little by little he increased the sales of the furniture that he makes.

Pablo lives in a peri-urban region called Perimetral. He has worked as and is known as a carpenter since he works from 8am until 8pm. In order to earn more income, he also has a small shop in the window of his home where he works with the help of his wife, since they have three small children, aged 13, 10, and 2 years old. The children study in a public school.

In order to continue with his business, he wants to buy wood and materials with the loan in order to have a higher level of production of furniture. One of his objectives is to establish a carpenter's workshop in the center of the city and to have greater demand for his furniture.

loans.use: To buy wood and materials

loans.name: Noelia Margarita

texts.es: Noelia Margarita E. T. de 41 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se encarga de atender su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Noelia vive junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad con quienes reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Noelia es madre soltera y la única que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos y de su hogar, por esta razón trabaja muy duro en su tienda, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: café en polvo, sodas, leche, golosinas, huevos, pan y otros productos más los cuales le permitan contar con más clientes y de esta misma forma más ganancias.
texts.en: Noelia Margarita E. T. is 41 years old. She is a very hardworking person who manages her own business -- a store that sells groceries and other basic products for the home. Noelia lives with her two children, aged ten and four, in the town of Atiquizaya which is part of the department of Ahuachapán. Noelia is a single mother, and she is the only person who looks out for the well-being of her children and her home. For this reason, she works very hard in her store since it is her only source of income. She is asking for a loan to purchase instant coffee, soft drinks, milk, sweets, eggs, bread, and other products that she needs to stock in order to be able to bring in more clients which would allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of convenience store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing inventory for retail sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de ropa para vender.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. sells palm fruits and slippers at Takoradi by moving from one area to another.  Cecilia is married and has three children.  Her husband is a driver.  She has been in this business for four years. 

She responsibly assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Her loan will be used to buy additional ladies shoes and slippers to expand her business.  She plans to build a shop from her increased capital.  Cecilia is pictured in one of her normal rounds to her customers.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy additional ladies shoes and slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica M. prepares banku, which is made from corn, for sale at Takoradi. She is divorced and lives together with her six dependents. Her banku business is a year old. She sees to the welfare of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to reinvest the additional income from the loan received.

loans.use: To buy corn to prepare banku for sale

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness Q. is a widow caring for three children. She sells fried and fresh fish in Takoradi.  She has been doing this for three years. Agness uses her income to educate, feed and clothe her children.  Agness will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agness plans to reinvest in her business.

In this photo, Agness has on a tray a few fish on display. She also has iced blocks on the tray which she uses to keep the fresh fish cold for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua K. sells fruits, especially oranges, in large quantities in Takoradi. She buys in large quantities and distributes it to her customers. Efua is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a security man. She assists her husband in the general well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fruits to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to expand business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Ama sells firewood and liquid soap in Takoradi. She assists her husband to provide the basic needs for the family. Ama will use the loan to purchase more firewood for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua S. is a widow and has three children. Ekua sells kenkey and banku in Takoradi.  She has been doing this for six years. Ekua uses her income to see to the welfare of her home.  Ekua will use the loan to buy more maize to cook banku for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy maize to make banku for sale

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba K. smokes fish for sale in Takoradi. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a driver. Abiba uses her income to assist her husband ensure that the family is well taken care off.  Abiba will use the loan to purchase additional fresh fish to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abiba plans to save to buy a piece of land.

In this picture, Abiba has finished arranging the fish to be smoked.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama K. sells maize, charcoal and firewood in Takoradi. She is a widow caring for five defendents. She is responsible for the welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of charcoal to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for sale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. is married and has one child. She sells cocoyam, plantain and charcoal in Takoradi. Her husband is a wood seller.  Nana assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Nana will use the loan to buy more foodstuffs to supply her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rosa; ella tiene 28 años. La socia es conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos  la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría gallinas, pollos, gallos, la socia también compra y vende maíz, la socia desea comprar polluelos tiernos para criar para el próximo año, la socia trabaja vendiendo animales cuando estos alcanzan su peso y tamaño ideal. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polluelos para la crianza.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Qorichuspa communal bank, located the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. Rosa is 28 years old. She lives with her partner and has four children. Her business is the raising of young animals. She raises hens and roosters. She also buys and sells corn. 

Rosa is seeking this loan to buy baby chicks to raise for next year. She will sell them when they reach the ideal size and weight. She is happy with the loan that is offered, and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: Buy baby chicks to raise.

loans.name: Edwin Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin Humberto V. F. vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrero de campo en la empresa Beta hace 3 años. El Sr. Edwin cuenta con buena acumulación de bienes y requiere el crédito para realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda. Su sueño segun nos comenta es tener una vivienda digna para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Edwin está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Edwin Humberto V. F. lives with his wife and son in the district of Santiago. He has worked as a field laborer for the Beta company for three years. He has been getting ahead, and now requires a loan to make improvements to his home.

Edwin says that his dream is to have a quality house to give his family a better quality of life. He is grateful for the support that is offered by this loan.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 1, 2 , 3 Group

texts.en:
Isabel is the coordinator of her group, Jehova Jireh 1, 2, 3. She makes her home in a simple structure in the rural area of Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Isabel lives with her husband and a child.  She has had her business for around 8 years, which she started after saving enough capital to open the business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes (like pants, shirts, etc.) and shoes. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, especially this Christmas season.

Isabel says that her most difficult challenges are to build her house and plan for better living conditions.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her work.  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Iona

texts.en:
Iona is married. She sells clothing at an open market in Novomoskovsk town. Good location and affordable prices attract many customers. Her net profit is 4,000 Grivnas.

Iona has been in the clothing sales business for 11 years. A few years ago, she took a break from her business to take care of her baby daughter. When her daughter turned two years old, Iona decided to return to her business. 

Iona is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to purchase additional inventory to increase sales. This business is the only source of income for Iona’s family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr: Uldarico; el tiene 62 años. La socia es casado  y tiene 7 hijos  el socio se dedica a la confección de disfraces para toda ocasión, cojines para sillones,  fundas de cama y otros, el socio realiza estas,  tareas en sus ratos libres el trabaja en la telefónica, el socio está a punto de jubilarse y luego se dedicará a trabajar íntegramente en su negocio casero, el ahora desea el préstamo para comprar telas, cintas y realizar algunos Santa Claus para la venta en esta época y de este modo tener un ingreso extra. El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar Santa Claus  y aprovechar las fiestas navideñas.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Qorichuspa" communal bank, a group that is located in the Huanchac district of the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Mr. Uldarico, who is 62 years old.  He is married and has seven children.  He sews costumes for every occasion, as well as seat cushions, bed covers, and other items.  He makes these in his spare time, as he also works in the telephone business.  He is on the verge of retiring and then he will fully dedicate himself to his home business.

At the moment, he would like a loan to buy fabric and ribbon to make Santa Claus costumes, in order to bring in some extra income in this season.  He is requesting this loan to capitalize on the Christmas celebrations by making Santa Claus costumes.

Mr. Uldarico is happy to receive this loan and he promises to comply with his repayments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to sew Santa Claus costumes and take advantage of the Christmas season to bring in some extra income

loans.name: Mujeres En Esperanza 3, 4 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Esperanza (Women in Hope).  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Josefina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bed clothes and pots by purchasing a few dozens of each. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing shoes, clothes, etc. Her long-term goal is to save enough money to purchase a home. She wants to be a successful business woman. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy bed clothes and pots

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has two adult sons. She sells clothing at the local open market. Ludmila started her business 10 years ago. Today she has three kiosks selling clothing. Ludmila works in one kiosk, and her husband and son sell in the other two. Good variety and affordable prices attract many clients.  Extensive experience helps Ludmila choose the right merchandise that will sell well.
