Guillermo is fifty-one years old. He lives in the district of Las Lomas in northern Peru. Las Lomas is a semi-tropical zone just a few hours away from the coastal desert in the province of Piura. It is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise animals. Guillermo is single. He lives in a home which he owns and shares with his older sister.

Guillermo raises sheep and cattle in corrals behind his home. He raises the sheep for their meat and sells them in the local markets, once they reach the appropriate size. The sheep meat serves as an important role in the nutrition of the local population and in the cultural traditions of Peru. Guillermo raises the cattle for milk. He sells the milk to the municipality.

In addition to his animals, Guilmero owns a hectare of land in the region which he inherited from his parents. He has a portion of the land planted with mature lime trees and another portion is planted with maracuya (a local fruit somewhat similar to the pomegranate which grows on a vine). He harvests the fruits regularly, selling them in local markets to wholesalers or to local factories.

This will be Guillermo’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use the funds to purchase additional balanced feed for his animals. He hopes that the investment will improve the health of his animals and also improve their production.

loans.use: Purchase additional balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is thirty-three years old. She shares her home with her husband and their two children. The family lives in the district of Las Lomas in northern Peru.  Las Lomas is a semi-tropical zone just a few hours away from the coastal desert in the province of Piura. It is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise animals. 

Hilda owns and operates a small general store out of her home. She attends to her clients on a daily basis, selling basic items such as hygiene supplies, dry goods, food and beverages. She is proud to be able to increase her neighborhood's access to these items. Hilda’s husband works on a plot of land that they own, growing various crops.

This will be Hilda’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She is well known in the area and has good references. She plans to use the credit to expand her inventory and to purchase a number of items at bulk discounts. She hopes this will allow her to meet the increased holiday demands of her customers and improve her income. She dreams of making improvements to her home and providing her kids with better educational opportunities.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to purchase a number of items at bulk discounts.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda M. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Imelda is married and has 12 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 6000 years and earns approximately  PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & junk foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like beverages & junk foods.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is tweny years old. Yuliana shares her home with her son and her husband. The family lives in the district of Tambogrande in northern Peru.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone just a few hours away from the coastal desert in the province of Piura. It is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise animals. 

Yuliana raises fowl in corrals behind her home. She raises chickens and turkeys. She cares for and feeds the animals until they reach the appropriate size to be sold for their meat. She sells the animals in local markets. The animals' meat serves as an important role in the nutrition of the local population and the cultural traditions of Peru. Yuliana’s husband works outside the home and he is only able to return home during the weekends.

This will be Yuliana’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed for her animals and to improve their corrals. She hopes the investments will promote the good health and production of her animals, thus increasing their value and her family’s income. She hopes to be able to improve the income of the household in order to allow her to spend more time with her husband and to provide her children with greater opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals and to improve her corrals.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Marleni is twenty-eight years old. She shares her home with her four children. The family lives in the district of Tambogrande in northern Peru.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone just a few hours away from the coastal desert in the province of Piura. It is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise animals. 

Marleni sells beauty products. She works primarily with the product line UNIQUE, a well-known company in the area, which provides women with access to business opportunities. Marleni has a good number of consistent clients. She visits her clients regularly and makes bulk orders twice per month. She sells products from inventory, on request and on credit. Her clients appreciate the good treatment she provides and the flexibility.

Marleni has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past. She has a good repayment record and has used the loans responsibly. She plans to use the funds to expand her inventory and to meet the last minute needs of her clients as the holiday season approaches. She hopes the investment will improve her market share and to improve her income ongoing.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to meet last minute needs of her clients as the holiday season approaches.

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en: Thuch P. is a 56-year-old married man and father. He lives with other family members in his own small family home in Kompong Cham Province. He owns a piece of land that he inherited from his grandmother. He grows different kinds of crops on his land, such as rice and corn, which he will sell to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. His wife also helps him in the same business. This couple has three school-aged children. Because his income is just enough for his family’s daily expenses, his house frequently cracks during the heavy rainy season. To solve this problem, he is requesting a loan to repair his old house.

loans.use: To repair his old house.

loans.name: Flordelita

texts.en:
Flordelita D. P. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Flordelita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Flordelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Flordelita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flordelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Flordelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
This is Heidi L., 42. She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo L. and together they have four children, two of whom are already working. One child is still studying in college, while the youngest is just barely able to toddle around at home. By the grace of God, Heidi has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Heidi has her own frozen-food business. She sells spiced hams, sweetened pork and native sausages and other delicacies of a popular brand. She earns income by getting supplies in at a wholesale price and selling at a piece rate on credit. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Heidi dreams to be able to have her own business stall soon, just as she fervently wishes her children finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Cerenia

texts.en: Cerenia M. is from the village of San Isidro, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old. Cerenia is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Cerenia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods. Cerenia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Cerenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Cerenia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and biscuits. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Cerenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and biscuits

loans.name: Willy Herbert

texts.es:
Willy tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos en el sector Indoamérica de la ciudad de Ferreñafe, una zona comercial ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de dos años a la comercialización de gas propano, el cuenta con un stock de este combustible en su vivienda, allí lo ofrece en venta al público en general. El negocio goza de mucha acogida debido a que la zona en donde vive está alejada del centro de la ciudad y este negocio es el único de su tipo en la zona. Además es de mucha utilidad para las familias del lugar que dependen de este combustible para la elaboración de sus alimentos.

Willy desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más balones de gas de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Anteriormente Willy ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. El préstamo le ayudó a surtir su negocio y captar más clientes, el nos comenta que actualmente está trabajando para una constructora y que gracias a los ingresos que esta actividad le brinda puede ayudar a su madre y a sus hermanos a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Willy is 27 years old, he is single and he lives together with his mother and siblings in the Indoamerica sector of the city of Ferrenafe. It is a commercial zone located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

For the past 2 years he has dedicated his time to the sale of propane gas. He has a supply of propane in his home and he sells to the general public. The business is very popular especially because the region where he lives is far from the downtown area of the city. This business is the only one of its type in the region. It is very useful for the families in the neighborhood because they depend on the fuel to cook their meals. 

Willy wishes to expand his business with the purchase of more cylinders of gas in order to satisfy client demand. For this reason he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. 

Willy has had a Kiva loan in the past through Edpyme Alternativa and its allied company Capital Semilla. The loan helped him to stock his business and it attracted more clients.  he is working for a construction company and with the income that he earns he is able to support his mother and siblings and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase propane.

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina S. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Lodivina is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lodivina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, instant noodles & snacks in the local community. Lodivina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lodivina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lodivina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lodivina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like beverages to sell

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak P. is a hard-working woman who earns her living by working on the rubber plantation as well feeding some pigs behind her house for extra profit. His husband also works in rubber plantation too. This family normally earns an average of $3 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. They have three kids who all work in different occupations. Recently, her pigs are not big enough due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, Prak P. has requested a loan that she will use to buy additional feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: To buy additional feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Callanca del distrito agrícola de Monsefú, una zona situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven: Por un lado se dedica a criar y vender cerdos entre sus vecinos y los negociantes de la zona, y por el otro se dedica a la siembra de artículos de pan llevar. Ambos negocios le brindan los ingresos que necesita para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

En esta oportunidad el ha sembrado arveja y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para que este cultivo pueda desarrollarse con mayor facilidad. Antonio se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de alimentos para sus cerdos y abonos para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de arveja.
texts.en:
Antonio is 32 years old, he is married, and he lives together with his wife and their four children in the sector of Callanca, in the agricultural district of Monsefu. It is a community located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been a farmer since he was very young. He raises and sells pigs to his neighbors and to the merchants in the region. But he also harvests grains to make breads. Each of these businesses provides him with the income that he needs to financially support his family. 

He has planted oats and he has been working arduously so that this harvest will give the best possible yield. Antonio requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. He plans to invest in the purchase of feed for his pigs and fertilizer for his oat plantation.

loans.use: To purchase feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 26 years old. Josephine is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business buying and selling bananas & rice per kilogram in the local community.  Josephine has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas & rice to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas & rice to sell

loans.name: María Violeta

texts.es:
María Violeta tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito D. Eten, una zona conocida porque sus pobladores se dedican a la elaboración D. artículos confeccionados D. junto. Se encuentra ubicada a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María cuenta con una bodega en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas. El negocio ya tiene tres años D. funcionamiento y durante este tiempo se ha ganado una clientela fidelizada. Su esposo trabaja como comerciante D. pescado en el terminal pesquero D. la región y con los ingresos que ambos perciben se encargan D. sacar adelante la economía D. su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente y percibir mayores ingresos por la venta D. su mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maria Violeta is 45 years old, she is married, and she lives together with her husband and their children in the district of Eten, a region known for its merchants who produce their articles in a group. It is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

Maria has a convenience store set up in her home. She offers her clients various types of groceries, snacks, and drinks. The business is three years old and during this time it has won a loyal client base. Her husband sells fish in the fishing district of the region. With both incomes they are able to financially support their family. 

Maria wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more products, to satisfy client demand. She will see an improvement in her earnings. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Agnes is single. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Agnes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Agnes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & beverages

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosa Elizabeth tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Eten, una zona conocida porque sus pobladores se dedican a la elaboración de artículos confeccionados de junto. Se encuentra ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Rosa cuenta con un establecimiento en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta al público en general artículos de bazar como losería, adornos de cerámica, regalos y juguetes. El negocio ya tiene una antigüedad de tres años. Adicionalmente cuenta con un taller en donde confecciona gorros para vendérselos a un acopiador que llega a dejarle pedidos. 

Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante la economía de su familia. Su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción y como chófer de mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado para brindar servicio de transporte publico, consiste en una motocicleta a la que se a anexado una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros).

Rosa desea ampliar su bazar con la compra de más artículos ya que durante esta temporada del año la demanda suele aumentar debido a las fiestas navideñas y de año nuevo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa Elizabeth is 45 years old, she is married and she lives together with her husband and their children in the district of Eten. It is a region known for its merchants who produce their articles in a group and it is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

Rosa has a store set up in her house from where she sells to the general public items such as dishes, ceramic decorations, gifts, and toys. The business is three years old. She also has a shop from where she makes hats that she sells to a retailer who comes and places orders.

The income that she earns helps her to financially support her family. Her husband is a construction worker and he also drives a motorcycle rickshaw (a motorized vehicle used to provide public transport and it is a motorcycle with an attached cabin that may be used to carry passengers or cargo).

Rosa wishes to expand her bazaar with the purchase of more merchandise to be ready for the end of year Christmas celebrations and New Year's parties. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Jenny Noemi

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la confección de prendas de vestir para todo público, para realizar su trabajo cuenta con un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de estas actividades ayuda  a su esposo, quien es obrero, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Jenny desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo materiales como telas y también desea brindar mantenimiento a su máquina de coser para poder asegurarse un buen funcionamiento de la misma, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles, con los cuales tiene planeado lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jenny is 22 years old, she is married, and she lives together with her husband and their young son in the district of Lambayeque, an important commercial region located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

For the past two years she has been making clothing for sale to the general public. She has a small shop in her home to make her products. With the income that she earns she is able to contribute with her husband, a laborer, towards the financial support of the family. 

Jenny wishes to expand her business with the purchase of materials, such as fabrics. She also wants to carry out some maintenance repairs to her sewing machine. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles. With this loan she will be able to reach her goal.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay P. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. She has four kids and most of them are employed in various jobs. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Presently, Hay P. is looking for a loan to buy a cow because her old cow doesn't support her field work during the plowing process.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de un menor hijo de seis años de edad y reside junto a sus padres en el sector La Esperanza del distrito de Reque, una zona situada aproximadamente a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Rosa cuenta desde hace nueve meses con una pequeña bodega en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas. Ella se esfuerza para sacar adelante su negocio y captar más clientes y siente que lo esta logrando, lo cual la pone muy contenta. Sus ganancias las utiliza para mantener a su menor hijo y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente y percibir mayores ingresos por la venta de su mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena is 27 years old; she is the mother of a six-year old son. She lives with her parents in the La Esperanza sector in the district of Reque. It is a region located approximately twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

For the past nine months she has had a small store installed in her home. From her store she is able to sell products of primary needs, such as groceries, snacks, and drinks. She works hard every day to make her business a success and to capture more clients. She feels that she is achieving her goal and this makes her very happy.  The income that she earns is used for the support of her young son and of her family. 

Rosa wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more products. She will be able to satisfy customer demand and to increase her profits. To this end she has requested a loan of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Miriam Margot

texts.es:
Miriam es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de sus clientes concentrados en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura y el comercio, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la venta de prendas de vestir. Ella vende uniformes, buzos, zapatos y ropa en general a sus clientes, Miriam ofrece sus productos de acuerdo a la temporada del año y adquiere su mercadería en las tiendas confeccionadoras de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gracias al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad, Miriam ha llegado a tener clientes fieles que a su vez han promocionado su negocio, lo que ha generado que cuente con una clientela estable. Actualmente desea adquirir capital para empezar a solicitar sus pedidos en las tiendas de Chiclayo y surtir su negocio con más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente  solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Miriam ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla, en aquella oportunidad ella pudo ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mercadería para la temporada escolar, lo cual le generó bastantes ingresos con los cuales su familia pudo salir adelante, ella se encuentra contenta y  agradece a todas las personas que le ayudaron a sacar adelante a su negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a mother, she is 44 years old and she lives together with her family in the district of Olmos. The region is known for its population that mostly resides in rural areas with great distances between them. The main businesses are agriculture and commerce and the region belongs to the province of Lambayeque. It is one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

For the past three years she has been selling clothing. She sells uniforms, sweaters, shoes, and general clothing items to her clients. Miriam sells clothing that is appropriate for the season. She acquires her merchandise from stores in the city of Chiclayo. 

Miriam has had a Kiva loan in the past through Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and its allied company Capital Semilla.  With the help of the first loan she was able to expand her business with the acquisition of merchandise in time for the new school year. This generated substantial earnings and it was of great benefit to her family. She is very happy and she is grateful to all those individuals that have helped her turn her business into a success.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita L. is from the village of San Jose, Gingoog City. She is 59 years old. Rosalita is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Rosalita owns & operates a business buying and selling coconuts for copra (meat) in the local community. Rosalita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts to sell

location.town: San Jose, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jose Florentino

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 64 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío Agua Blanca del distrito de Olmos, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad a la agricultura. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

José cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su domicilio con la cual satisface la demanda por productos de uso diario en sus clientes. Allí ofrece diversos productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte de los pobladores de la zona. Sus ganancias las utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas.

José desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente y percibir mayores ingresos por la venta de su mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is a 64 year-old father who lives with his family in the village of Agua Blanca, in Olmos district.  This is a rural area whose main economic activity is farming.  It is located in Lambayeque province and is more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

José has a small grocery store in his home with which he satisfies his customers' demands for daily-use products.  He offers a range of essentials, groceries, candy and drinks.  His business is very popular with the residents of his area.  He uses his profits to help his family get ahead in life.  José also does farm work.

José would like to expand his business by acquiring more products so that he can satisfy the demand that he has right now and make more income from the sale of his merchandise.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire more products

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores, reside junto a su familia en el distrito de La Victoria, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra situada cerca a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace siete años a la venta de frutas y verduras de estación en un puesto ambulante del mercado modelo, el adquiere su mercadería a los productores de la zona en el mercado mayorista de la región. Actualmente ofrece en venta maíz morado, su clientela se encuentra fidelizada y siempre acude a su establecimiento a adquirir sus productos ya que siempre los vende frescos. Esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia a salir adelante.

Florencio desea adquirir más frutas de estación para surtir su negocio y satisfacer su demanda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Florencio is 48 years old.  He is married and has two dependent children.  He lives with his family in La Victoria district which is quite a commercial area located near the city of Chiclayo.

For seven years, Florencio has been selling seasonal fruit and vegetables on a stall in the 'mercado modelo' market.  He acquires his merchandise from local farmers in the regional wholesale market.  He currently sells 'maíz morado' (purple corn).  He has loyal customers who always come to his establishment to buy since he always sells fresh produce.  This business allows Florencio to cover his personal expenses and support his family in getting ahead.

Florencio would like to acquire more seasonal fruit to stock his business and satisfy demand.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa with which he plans to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire more seasonal fruit to stock his business and satisfy demand

loans.name: Badamdorj

texts.en:
Badamdorj is 45 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live in a wooden house. He operates a trucking business in which he transports goods, such a wooden materials, to the 44th Building Market. 

His wife operates a dairy business during the summer time. His eldest daughter studying physics and electronics at the national university. His other three children attend the local secondary school.  

In 2000, he moved to Ulaanbaatar to open his transportation business. During his first year of business, it was difficult for him to conduct business because other drivers, in competing businesses, were pushing him out of the market. But he didn't give up and, after years of operation, he has gained a lot of experience.

Badamdorj used his saving to purchased a family truck and his own plot of land with a house. This is his 6th loan from Credit Mongol. Now he is requesting a 3.200.000 MNT loan to purchase cheaper meat from rural areas so he can sell it for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cheaper meat from rural areas

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos Enrique tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su madre en sector Cruz de la Esperanza, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Estudió en la universidad de la zona Agronomía y los conocimientos que adquirió le han servido para conseguir un trabajo de vendedor de insumos químicos para brindar mantenimiento a diversos cultivos. El cuenta con un grupo de clientes que ha podido ganarse con el tiempo y a los cuales visita regularmente ofreciéndoles sus productos que brinda y brindándoles asesoría. Esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Su madre esta separada y el trata siempre de apoyarla para sacar adelante a sus hermanos.

Carlos desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, de este modo desea brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carlos Enrique is 25 years old, single and lives with his mother in the Cruz de la Esperanza sector, an urban area on the outskirts of Chiclayo. Chiclayo is a commercial district and the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Carlos studied Agronomy at university and the knowledge that he gained in that course has helped him to gain employment selling chemical supplies to maintain various crops. Carlos has a group of clients who he visits regularly, providing them with both products and consultancy services. This has helped him to earn a living, cover his personal costs and support his family. As his mother is separated, Carlos has always tried to help her to bring up his siblings.

Carlos would like to make some improvements on his home to afford his family a better quality of life, which is why he is now applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To make improvements on his home

loans.name: José Segundo Alfredo

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y reside junto a su familia en el el sector La Esperanza del distrito de Reque, una zona situada aproximadamente a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores pecuarias desde hace varios años. El cría vacas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y diariamente extrae la leche que producen para venderla a un acopiador y al público en general. Adicionalmente cría cuyes para consumo humano, la carne de estos animales es bastante estimada a nivel nacional y constituye uno de los elementos principales de la comida típica peruana, el comercializa estos animales entre los vecinos de su zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

José desea completar el monto que necesita para adquirir una nueva vaca de modo que pueda aumentar su producción y ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is a 39 year-old father.  He has three children and lives with his family in the La Esperanza sector of Reque district.  This area is located approximately twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

José has been raising livestock for several years.  He raises cows out the back of his home and every day he milks his cows and sells the milk to a trader and the general public.  He also raises guinea pigs for human consumption.  The meat of these animals is quite well liked nationally and it is one of the main elements of traditional Peruvian cuisine.  He sells these animals to his neighbors.  José uses the profits he makes from these activities to get his family ahead financially.

José would like to complete the sum he needs to buy a new cow so that he can increase his production and sales.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To complete the sum he needs to buy a new cow

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Las Delicias del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola poblada principalmente por personas humildes y trabajadoras. La zona se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque y está ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y animales menores, el cría los animales en diversos ambientes ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya se han desarrollado completamente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente complementa sus ingresos económicos dedicándose a trabajar en labores agrícolas como jornalero.

El desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Pedro is 35 years old, married and lives with his wife and  two children in the rural area of Las Delicias in the Mórrope district, an agricultural zone populated mainly by humble, hardworking people.  This area is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour from the city Chiclayo.  

He has been raising and selling cattle and small animals for more than five years now.  He raises the animals in different areas outside his house.  When they are completely developed he sells them to businessmen that usually visit the area where he lives.  He also works as an agricultural laborer to supplement his income.  

Pedro would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed.  For this reason he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] which will help him to reach his goal.

loans.use: To purchase more animals and feed

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 29 años de edad, es separado, vive en casa de sus padres y tiene a su cargo un pequeño hijo. Reside en el el sector La Esperanza del distrito de Reque, una zona situada aproximadamente a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un pequeño taller de mecánica en donde brinda servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos motorizados, adicionalmente complementa esta actividad con la venta de repuestos para vehículos. Debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando en esta actividad actualmente cuenta con una clientela bastante fidelizada. El complementa sus actividades realizando trabajos agrícolas y con los ingresos que percibe se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y mantener a su menor hijo.

Marcos desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más repuestos y herramientas, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que espera implementar su negocio y mejorar su atención.
texts.en:
Marcos is 29 years old.  He is separated and lives in his parents' house where he takes care of his young son.  He lives in La Esperanza sector of Reque district.  This area is located approximately twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Marcos has a small garage where he repairs and services vehicles.  In addition to this, he also sells vehicle spare parts.  Owing to the amount of time he has been working in this business, he currently has quite a loyal customer base.  He supplements his businesses by doing farm work and he uses the profits he makes to get his family ahead and support his young son.

Marcos would like to expand his business by purchasing more spare parts and tools.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa with which he hopes to keep his business going and improve his customer service.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and tools

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda F. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan,  South Cotabato. She is 62 years old. Wenefreda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Wenefreda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, toothpaste & junk food in the local community. Wenefreda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Wenefreda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wenefreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Wenefreda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Wenefreda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch H. has been in the farming business for years in Kompong Cham Province. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2.50 per day. She has a partner in her husband who works as a construction worker, making an average profit of $3.50 per day. In addition, she is a Khmer cake seller in her community for more income. This rice harvesting season, Touch H. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice commands the highest price. Touch H. and her husband are pictured in photograph.

loans.use: To purchase rice to store and sell later when the rice commands the highest price.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Western Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Helen is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk food & beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk food & beverages

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo B. is from the village of Malunno Norte,Benito Soliven Isabela. He is 45 years old. Rodrigo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodrigo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP per harvest.

Rodrigo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rodrigo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion A. is from the village of Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 61 years old. Salvacion is widowed and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Salvacion owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & beverages in the local community. Salvacion has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salvacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salvacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Salvacion is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snacks & biscuits. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Salvacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like snacks & biscuits to sell

location.town: Cebuano Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida S. is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old. Bienvenida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Bienvenida owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services like school uniforms to local community members. Bienvenida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bienvenida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bienvenida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. Bienvenida is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Bienvenida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 46-year-old married woman from Antipolo in the province of Rizal. She is blessed to have three children. All of whom are minor age and need her support. She is a member of the East Kamias center of Rizal West Branch. Rita is a very strong-minded woman, and notes that she works harder to make their life quite meaningful. Despite trials brought about by poverty, Rita is still strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s quality of living. 

To make a good living, she buys and sells RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes). She has been engaged in this business for 4 years. She joined ASHI, a first Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2007. During the course of her membership, she has performed well with attendance at center meetings, repayment, and business.

She is now requesting a new loan; this time in the amount of 24,000 PHP, to obtain additional stocks of her RTW. She is positive that, with access to additional working capital through Kiva partners, her dreams of financial stability for the entire family will be achieved.

Rita hopes that one day she will be able to have her own produce stall in the market place, instead of from her house. from which to sell her RTW products. She wishes to be able to make enough savings to pay for her children's education and also dreams of the best life for her family. Rita’s main goal of offer her three children a brighter future is what motivates her every day.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventories of RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes) to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok N., age 51, is a mother blessed with three children. Two of the children are single, and one is married. One of her children is a worker who works in a bread shop, and has a regular salary about $25 per month. Sok N. currently generates an income of approximately $2.5 per day by selling Khmer cake. Sok N. has a life partner in her husband who is a local farmer in Kompong Cham Province. Presently, her selling business is running very well and she wishes to expand her business. So that Sok N. requests a loan as additional capital to buy raw material for making Khmer cake for selling. Sok N. and her husband are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making Khmer cake for selling.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde O. is from the village of Magsaysay,Naguillan,Isabela. She is 50 years old. Clotilde is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Clotilde owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling frozen foods and soft drinks in the local community. Clotilde has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Clotilde joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clotilde has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Clotilde is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Clotilde from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marfina

texts.en:
Marfina B. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 50 years old. Marfina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marfina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Marfina has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marfina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marfina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Marfina is requesting a new loan of 32000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Marfina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna M. is 39 years old, married, and lives in the province of Antipolo, Rizal, in the Philippines with her husband and four minor children. To make a better living, Edna owns and operates a business of retailing of dry goods and RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes) in her neighborhood. 

She has been a busy entrepreneur for almost three years. Edna would like to receive a loan to purchase more inventory of dried goods and RTW. Edna believes in offering a variety of products in her house for customers seeking convenient purchases. 

Her long term goals are to expand her retailing business and sustain her family financially.  With the support of Kiva lenders, she is focused to develop a winning business with her entrepreneurial effort.  

Edna is grateful for the secured access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders across the world for offering her financial support and a chance to reach her dreams in life. She prays that they all will be blessed.

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs.Badamtsetseg is 43 years old. She lives with her husband, younger daughter, and granddaughter in "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since 1999, she has run a shoe business. She buys shoes from wholesalers who bring them from abroad, and she sells them at the Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in the city. She rents two stalls at the market. Her husband, Enkhbat, helps in her business part time and also runs a taxi and delivery business using the family car. Their goal is to accumulate anough money to build a family house in the future and to give a proper education to their children. She has a two daughters. Her older daughter, a university graduate, lives separately with her husband. The younger one is a university student. 

This time of the year, the temperature drops to -25 to -30 degrees Celsius (-13 to -22 degrees Fahrenheit) and winter warm shoes are in big demand. Therefore, she wants to use this loan to increase her working capital and inventory.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and inventory for the winter season

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 38 years old and married. She resides in Antipolo, which is located in the Province of Rizal. She has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. 

Shirley is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities to sell. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. 

Her business is very important because it enables her to provide better financial stability for her family to live in a decent manner. She hopes to provide them with everything necessary to move forward against poverty. Shirley’s dreams of the best for her family are to have an expanded business and to have a happy family.  She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded and able to make her dreams come true. 

She hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and improve her overall quality of living, rising out of poverty. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders across the world for sponsoring poor women like her who want to get ahead. She prays that they will be blessed.

loans.name: Tumennasan

texts.en:
Tumennasan B. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and adult son in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His only son attends university. Tumennasan owns his own iron/metal work business where he produces a variety of iron items outside of his fence. He began his business in 2000 and has gained a lot of experience and skills as a iron smith. His wife helps him with the business. 

After many years of successful development, he was able to build a stable operation. His business earnings have enabled him not only to provide for his family but also to pay his son's tuition fees. For the future, he plans to expand his business by producing more various iron products. Moreover he hopes to establish his own car repair shop. 

Tumennasan is a modest and honest man and says, "I want to continue operating my business at a sustainable level so that I can continue to afford my son's tuition fees." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his iron products production.

loans.name: Musamidin

texts.en:
Musamidin B. is 42 years old. He works as an army account officer. He has three sons. His eldest son is a student in the capital city Bishkek, the second is his main helper on their farm, and the youngest is a schoolboy. His wife works as an accountant at the local hospital. Unfortunately, salaries in rural areas are not high and do not cover all expenses of the household, so this couple needs to find an additional means of subsistence for their family.
 
In his area of the country, farming is one of the main activities, so Musamidin decided to engage farming. He started this business with 30,000 KGS and managed to expand his business by renting land where he planted wheat. 

Musamidin plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for his land. With the revenues, Musamidin wants to buy gasoline and fuel for rented processing equipment and more wheat seeds. 

Musamidin is a very positive and hard-working person who believes that his efforts will lead his family to a prosperous future. 


About Bai-Tushum:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

She also buys and sells vegetables & green bananas. Mericon has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa E. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house with fence in Selenge province, Mongolia. She was married twice and has four children. The older two children live on their own while the younger two children live with her. Her older child attends university and her middle son attends a local primary school. Her husband is a driver and operates a taxi service to supplement the family earnings.

 Bolormaa operates a clothes-making business in her town. She not only sews traditional Mongolian-style clothing, but she also sews European-style clothing. She started her own business in 1996 after working as a seamstress in a tailoring company between 1990 and 1996. For the future, she plans to expand her business by hiring more workers. She will use this loan to purchase necessary equipment and tools, more materials for a new assistant who will be hired soon in order to keep up with the high demand for her products. 

Because she has gained a lot of experience, she has established a wide and loyal customer base. She is requesting a 2,400,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and tools, equipment such as a zigzag machine and another sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and tools, equipment such as zigzag and sewing machines

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel P. is 32 years old and lives with his mother, siblings and infant daughter in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His mother operates a salt trading business, while he operates a machinery parts trading business in his town. He started his business in 2007 by selling motorcycle parts and providing a car repair service. Over the years, he has gained much experience in his trade and always tries to grow and improve his business. He has built a stable business and positive reputation among his customers, and today his working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. His earnings have enabled him to have his own workplace. For the future, he hopes to expand his business by increasing his working capital, to improve his family's standard of living. Altangerel is a hardworking man and is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to buy supplies for his motorcycle parts trading business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his motorcycle parts trading business

loans.name: Mirian Roxana

texts.es: Mirian Roxana M. A. de 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo de 9 años de edad, junto a los cuales reside en la colonia Los Tulipanes en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Mirian es una persona muy  trabajadora, la cual se encarga de vender verduras en el mercado regional de Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual trabaja junto a su esposo. Ambos son dos personas muy responsables quienes se dedican en gran manera a su hogar y al bienestar de su hijo. Mirian solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras y frutas, sobretodo tomates, chiles verdes y cebollas las cuales suben de precio en esta temporada de fin de año y así mismo su demanda se incrementan, lo cual pueda aprovechar al máximo.
texts.en:
Mirian Roxana M. A. is 30 years of age and lives with her husband and her nine year old son in the Los Tulipanes district, located in the department of Ahuachapán. Mirian is very hardworking and is in charge of selling vegetables in the Ahuachapán regional market, where she works alongside her husband. They are both very responsible and devoted to their home and the wellbeing of their son. 

Mirian is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of fruit and vegetables, above all tomatoes, green chillies and onions which rise in price at this time of year . As demand for them also rises, Mirian will be able to take full advantage of their sale.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for resale

location.town: Colonia Los tulipanes, departamento de Ahuachapán

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Penh M., 30, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, where she earns a living raising pigs and farming her own farmland. She has been running this business since 2005, and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a firewood seller. They have only two children, both of whom are single and living under their care. This couple currently owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. Unfortunately, the machine has often broken down during the plowing process. Because of this problem, Penh M. would like a loan to fix her broken cultivating machine.

loans.use: To fix her broken cultivating machine.

loans.name: Marta Ester

texts.es: Marta Ester A. D. R. D. 62 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como jornalero, y así mismo vive junto a dos nietos D. 14 y 6 años D. edad. Marta se dedica a la venta D. ropa para hombres mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa en el mercado D. San Juan Opico, en donD. posee muy buena clientela, por lo que sus ventas son muy estables. Marta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, D. manera que pueda tener diferentes tallas, estampados y colores, los cuales le permitan aumentar sus ingresos y D. esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
62 year-old Marta Ester A. D. R. lives in Santa Tecla, in La Libertad department.  She lives together with her husband, who works as a day laborer, and also with two grandchildren aged 14 and 6.

Marta's business is selling men's, women's and children's clothes in San Juan Opico market.  She has a very good customer base which means that her sales are very stable.

Marta is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes so that she can have different sizes, patterns and colors which will allow her to increase her income and thereby enjoy better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy clothes to stock her business

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela R. R. de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo tres hijos y dos nietos, junto a los cuales reside en el departamento de San Salvador. María posee una venta de comida, la cual esta en su casa de habitación, esta zona cuenta con mucho comercio, por lo que posee muchos clientes fijos quienes comen a diario sus alimentos. Las ganancias generadas por este negocio son muy importante para la estabilidad de su familia, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras, frutas, especias, pastas y otros productos más con los cuales tenga todos los recursos necesarios para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Ángela R. R. is 48 years of age and lives with her husband, three children and two grandchildren in the department of San Salvador. María prepares and sells meals from her home. As the area where she lives is quite commercial, she has many loyal customers who come to eat daily at her house. 

The income that is generated by this business is very important for the stability of her family, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables, fruit, spices, pasta and other products in bulk. With these products she will have all the necessary resources to offer a better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Kalyibubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalyibubu O., 59, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a small town in the Isykul region. Kalyibubu is married,and  her husband works as a security guard at a school. Together they brought up six daughters and three sons. All the children are married and live separately with their families.

 In 1996 when the collective farms broke up, the family was given a piece of land and since that time, Kalyibubu and her husband have been cultivating agricultural produce and breeding livestock.  With money received from this loan, Kalyibubu wants to purchase coal for heating during the winter season.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
