texts.es: Reina de La Paz M. P. de 66 años de edad, se ha dedicado a trabajar muy duro toda su vida para salir adelante, ella vive en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután en donde vive junto a dos hermanas y un pequeño nieto d 4 años de edad, quien se encuentra a su cuidado. Reina trabaja elaborando y vendiendo platillos típicos como: yuca frita, tamales de elote, enchiladas, pupusas, pastelitos de carne y otros más, estos alimentos ella los comercializa en su casa de habitación y así mismo de forma ambulante. El mayor deseo de Reina es el de crecer en su negocio, y de esta forma contar con una vida mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Reina de La Paz M. P. is 66 years old.  She has worked very hard her whole life to get ahead.  She lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department together with two sisters and a 4 year-old grandson who is in her care.

Reina makes and sells traditional food such as: fried cassava, corn tamales, enchiladas, pupusas, 'pastelitos de carne' (meat pastries), etc.  She sells the food from her home and also as an itinerant street vendor.

Reina's biggest wish is to grow her business and thereby create a better life for herself and her family.

texts.es: Walter Wilfredo L. de 52 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida en el calvario en el departamento de Usulután. Walter es un hombre muy trabajador el cual se dedica a la venta de zapatos, su venta es ambulante ya que a diario el debe colocar sus productos en la acera del centro de Usulután, un lugar muy concurrido y de mucho comercio. La venta de zapatos es la única fuente de ingresos con la que él cuenta para tener todo lo necesario para vivir, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos en diferentes estilos y tallas, el mayor deseo de Walter es el poder aprovechar esta temporada navideña y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y así invertir aún más en su venta.
texts.en:
Walter is 52 years old and lives with his life companion in El Calvario, Usulatan department.  Walter is a hard working man dedicated to selling shoes.  He does so on the streets, and every day he has to place his merchandise on the sidewalks of central Usulutan, a much-frequented location that offers lots of commerce.

Shoe sales is the only source of income Walter can count on to provide all that is necessary to live, and for that reason he is requesting a loan in order to purchase more shoes in different styles and sizes.  Walter's greatest desire is to be able to take advantage of this Christmas season and improve his income, in order to invest even more in his sales.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been dedicating herself to developing her frozen foods business in order to support her dream of improving her family's quality of life. She will be very responsible with her obligations and she is thankful to the people who will support the loan she is requesting. This loan will be very helpful in making her business grow further so that her two children can fulfill their dreams of getting college degrees and finding great jobs.

Maria continues to runs her business to generate income and to financially support her family. She would like to increase her weekly income. For this drive, she applied for a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more stocks of frozen foods and increase her working capital. Maria has already had previous loans from ASHI and repaid them successfully. Therefore, she is being trusted with a much larger loan.
 
As active businesswoman, Maria would also like to explore more business opportunities for herself in the future, in order to proviD. her family a good living. Through business success, Maria would also like to invest in their home. 

She is very pleased to be a Kiva borrower and says "thank you" for helping fund her business dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of frozen foods and increase her working capital

loans.name: Yrysbu's Group

texts.en:
Yrysbu A., 58, is the leader of this group. Her husband works as a driver at a hydro-electro station. They have three sons and two daughters. In order to earn money Yrysbu breeds cattle, as they have been doing for twenty years.  In order to expand their herd, Yrysbu applied for this loan. In the future, she wants to purchase a vehicle for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

She plans to use the additional proceeds generated from the business to develop business.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders across the world for supporting her dreams and offering financial services to poor women who want to get ahead. She prays that they all should be blessed.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina  A. is 31 years old, married, and supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, Avon dealer, and ready to wear sales. She lives in Bagumbayan, Maribago, Cordova, Cebu.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in all of her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000. Marcelina is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marcelina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell.

This couple has three lovely children who are all studying at public school. 

This rice harvesting season, Yun S. hasn't harvested her rice crop yet. So she would like to ask for a loan to hire the domestic labor needed to harvest.

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en:
Ofelia J. is from the village of Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Ofelia is the leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ofelia is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the third loan taken by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is a 25-year-old, married woman from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. Marilyn and her husband have one school-age child. To earn a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where her primary source of income is derived from buying and selling everyday products such as shampoo, soap, detergents, canned goods, and junk food in her local community. Marilyn has been engaged in this business for over 6 years, and she earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. In turn, she is better able to engage in business activities and should be able to improve her family's standard of living. Marilyn is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as biscuits and junk food. This loan would be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by increasing inventory

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen D. is a married woman who lives in Bagumbayan, Brgy. Maribago, Cordova, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a retail business venture. Specifically, she runs a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, Roger D., who is 39 years old, works as a bartender to earn his living. They have six children between the ages of 1 and 18 years old, four of whom are currently attending school.

Arleen joined Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of a prior loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arleen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, thereby improving her family's standard of living. Now, she is seeking a second loan, this time in the amount of 10,000 ($250), which she intends to use to purchase inventory to sell so that she can continue to save up for her family's future needs. Arleen says that she is a Dungganon woman following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon, which is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through its alleviation program, NWTF empowers these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To expand and improve her store by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia D. is a 55-year-old, married woman from the village of Public, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She and her husband have six adult-age children. To earn a living, Verginia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where her primary source of income is derived from buying and selling everyday products such as shampoo, soap, detergents, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk food in her local community. Verginia has been engaged in this business for over 10 years, and she earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Verginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. By doing so, she expects to be better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Verginia is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk food and canned goods. This loan would be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Kabidolda

texts.en: Kabidolda H. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Kabidolda operates a transportation business in his town. He drives a minibus to transport people while his wife helps him by working as a conductor in his minibus. He works his business 15 days in a month. Kabidolda is a hardworking and honest man and is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase tires and a new engine for his bus.

loans.use: To purchase tires and new engine

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar H. is a 29 year old woman who lives with her husband and two sons in Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son currently attends a local primary school and the youngest is in kindergarden. Her husband works as an assistant driver for a private transportation business and receives a salary between 50,000 and 150,000 MNT depending on his trip. Otgonbayar operates a clothing retail business at the local market. She started her business in September, 2010. For the near future, she hopes to establish a stable business and hopes to buy her own workplace with her future business profits. Otgonbayar is a modest person and is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell during the upcoming New Year holiday.  She can perhaps increase her sales then.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell during the upcoming New Year holiday

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: Pin N. is a 37-year-old woman, married to Orm Brous, age 37, and they both appear in the picture here. This couple has no children. They make their living by planting various crops on their own farmland.  From this business they can generate an income of around US$ 4.75 per day. This rice-harvesting season, Pin N. wishes to buy rice in bulk from another village at low cost, stock it, and then resell it to gain more profit.

loans.use: To buy rice and stock it to sell when the price rises.

loans.name: Emie Rose

texts.en:

To make a living, Emie Rose owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, toothpaste & snack food in the local community. Emie Rose has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emie Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie Rose is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like food & canned goods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Emie Rose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. is a 47-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a tailoring  business.  She lives in Nabantuan hills, Brgy Balintawak, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. By working hard in her tailoring business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.Virginia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and insure their future wellbeing by following the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) Project Dungganon way. 

Virginia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1991 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from the NWTF and through her own efforts.  She now earns an average monthly income of 5000 PHP. Virginia would now like to borrow 18,000 PHP so that she can have additional capital for her tailoring business.  This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, the NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect of the community through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Join our team and help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Doljin

texts.en: Doljin D. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger — a traditional Mongolian nomadic ten — in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son attends a local high school while her husband operates a transportation business to support the family. Doljin operates a dairy and meat trading business. She purchases meats and dairy products at wholesale prices from a small nearby village and transports these products to her town in order to sell to them to traders at the local market. She started her business in 2007 and has since built a stable and successful operation. She has established her business in the local community and has gained a lot of loyal customers. For the future, she hopes to continue to increase the success of her business and make repairs to her husband's car. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meats and dairy products in order to increase her sales in the market.

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Juliet M. makes common cause with Kiwanga Women's Group-Mukono. She has been selling timber for ten years under the supportive auspices of her husband, who she says was the one person who inspired to start her business. Formerly, she was a teacher.

texts.en:

The loan will be used by Dewa Ayu Ketut for:
1. The purchase of three piglets with a price Rp.750.000.
2. The remainder of capital was used to purchase food for the piglets.

Profits that she got from the earlier period of Rp. Advantages 500,000. has been used for her children's education expenses.

Dewa Ayu Ketut hopes this loan will further intensify its efforts for the welfare of her family.

Enkhjargal is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a red brick house. Her husband is a carpenter, but he works only in summer time. Her eldest son, Batenkh, studies at the university, and her youngest daughter, Batchimeg, attends a local secondary school. 

Enkhjargal operates a grocery store on their plot of land. She used her earnings to pay for her son’s tuition fees and to purchase items for her store, such as a refrigerator. She is an open-minded person who has very good communication skills. She says, "the most important thing to me is provide a good education for my children." 

She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital and inventory.

loans.name: Serikbol

texts.en: Serikbol J. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four sons in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Serikbol operates a livestock husbandry business in his town. He began his business in 2005 and after several years of operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community. During winter, he sells mare's milk (fermented milk), which is very profitable to sell. Currently he owns two horses and three cows. For the future, he plans to increase the number of his livestock. Because of his business success, he has used his earnings to provide for his family. He says, " All I want is to have my own farm." Serikbol is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more hay to feed his livestock.

loans.use: To purchase more hay to feed his livestock

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: adjoa est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé-ablogamé qui est un quartier périphérique animé de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de Tissus. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. elle a déjà obtenu du crédit pour s'approvisionner elle sollicite ce second crédit pour s'approvisionner et bien vendre en fin d'année. ainsi elle projette acheter 5 rouleaux de tissu pour chemises, 5 rouleaux de tissus pour pantalon.
texts.en:
Adjoa is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Adidogomé-Ablogamé, a busy suburb of the city of Lomé. 

She sells fabrics for a living. She gets her stocks at the big market of Lomé. She previously received a loan to increase her stocks. She is now seeking a second loan to purchase more merchandise and boost her year-end sales. She plans to buy five rolls of fabric for shirts, and five rolls of fabric for trousers.

loans.use: Buying fabrics

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru:
Gulnar S. 36 let . Ona ne zamujem. Gulnar yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar , seychas projivayet v Asbheron regioen vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Ona uje 10 let kak rabotayet uchitelniccey , etoy rabote ona nauchilas u svoyey mami tak kak i ona bila uchitelniccey a tak je ona okonchila specialnoye uchilishe.  Gulmaya seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit testi i knigi dlya detey u kotorix net vozmojnosti samim pokupat. Gulmaya gotovit detey dlya postupleniya v universiteti , kajdiy qod vixodyat noviye kniqi i testi dlya podqotovki v universitet i oni stoyat ochen doroqo ne kajdiy mojet pokupat eti knigi i gotovitsya i poeotomu Gulmaya pokupayet eti knigi i dayet im uchitsya po etim knigam posle cheqo oni vozvrashayut yey eti knigi.
texts.en: Gulnar S., 26, is an internally displaced person who had to resettle from Absheron to Kalbadjar with her family. Gulnar is single. A daugther of a teacher and a graduate of a teachers' college, Gulnar spent the last ten years teaching. She prepares school children for university entrance exams, and every year she needs to purchase new preparation materials for her students. She is applying for a loan of 2000 AZN that would allow her to buy tests and books for those school children who can't afford it.

loans.use: to buy tests and books

loans.name: Mrs. Som Khim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of fourteen people who live in Kampaor Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Som K. has been selected by the other members to be the village bank president. Each member will use their portiO. of the loan for different purposes, but all hope to improve their families' living standards.
  
Mrs. Som K. buys and sells fruits and vegetables to earn money to support her family. She also breeds pigs and chickens. Her husband, Mr. Vy M., is a farmer. To support his family, he grows rice O. a small piece of land that he owns. 

Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Som K. is seeking for a loan to buy piglets, pig food, and chickens. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy a bicycle.

She is a mother of five children, one of whom is employed in garment factory. Her other children attend the public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets, pig food, and chickens

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita H. is from the village of Kilikili, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Clarita is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Clarita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Clarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk food & canned goods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Clarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk food & canned goods

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en: The Tegal Sari group, with N. Ketut W. as the leader, has 10 members who are applying for a second loan with an aggregate amount  of Rp.15,000,000. With this loan, she is expected to increase her business capital for raising pigs. With the first loan, she managed to obtain a flat gain of Rp.100,000  to 150,000. The profit was used to supplement their daily needs and to pay school fees. She hopes this cooperation continues in the future.

loans.use: Capital for raising pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena G. is from the village of Kilikili, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 27 years old. Rowena is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr: dynamique et motivée, adidjatou a commencé il y a plus de 10 ans déjà le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle exerce son activité à la devanture de sa maison. elle s'approvisionne dans divers marchés locaux à lomé. les périodes de fêtes de fin d'année étant proche elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour accroître son stock de marchandises avec  8 cartons de boîtes de conserve, 13 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 2 cartons de poissons congelés, 7 cartons de savons et divers.
texts.en: An energetic and motivated woman, Adidjatou started a groceries business over ten years ago.  She operates her business in front of her house.  She gets her supplies from various local markets in Lomé.  Since the year-end holidays are fast approaching, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to increase her stock of merchandise with:  8 boxes of canned goods, 13 boxes of pasta, 2 boxes of frozen fish, 7 boxes of soap, and more.

loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: 6 Nam  Sơn1 - Nam Ngan Group

texts.vi:
"Quy N. T. (23) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố T. Hoa.  Quy là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04.1.6 Nam Ngan (02.04.1.6 Nam Ngan).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Quy thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quy kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Quy đã tham gia T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quy đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. T. Lap (24) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

2.  T. T. Ngoc (25) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

3.  P. T. Thuy (26) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.

4.  N. T. Lien (27) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5.  L. T. Ve (28) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo T. Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh T. Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."
texts.en:
Quy N. T. (23) is a 35 year-old female living in the town of T. Hoa.  Quy is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04.1.6 Nam Ngan (02.04.1.6).


Quy is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To making a living, Quy owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business.  While not the onL. means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primariL. from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Quy has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximateL. 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Quy joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Quy is requesting for the first time a loan from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    She is now requesting a new loan of 4.248.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Quy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's famiL..


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Lap (24) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  T. T. Ngoc (25) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  P. T. Thuy (26) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


4.  N. T. Lien (27) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  L. T. Ve (28) is a 56 year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costL., Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials
